Author: fezington
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Nabi-Marie | B2Expand23.04.2019 Hello everyone, I'm writing this from Lyon, from the same studio address as before, and it's not so close to the beach. :grinning: We're working on Light Trail, our second title which will use our Nexarium ecosytem and our cryptocurrency Nexium. Only this time, we think it's best to include other means of monetizing (players will be able to buy digital assets in euros using their credit cards like in any other games). We're working hard on developing an ecosystem which will reward early adopters. I believe everyone knows that the mass adoption for blockchain games is still on its way and many fellow developers and ourselves have been working hard to make it happen. We're just focusing on making a great title with a cool blockchain ecosystem. We can't control external factors (crypto winter, bearish market, blockchain technical issues with poor UX). So we're currently focusing on making a great game. We're open , we'd be happy to answer any questions if they are real and help you to know us better. Please feel free to reach out.  That's from their discord. They don't even bother answering in this thread. It's always the same: When they need the funding, they couldn't get enough attention and communication. Author: fezington
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: The question is not "if" NXC will get delisted but "when". Let's take a look:  Total buy orders:  1.066 BTC  655042.631 NXC  Total sell orders: 51.273 BTC  2993705.179 NXC  Daily volume:  $933.15  BTC0.15000000  This coin brings no gains for any exchange because nobody is trading it except for the bots.  Now why would a startup let its coin die? it's (allegedly) their only source of income and their "war chest" for bad times as they once claimed. Imagine Elon Musk not giving a shit about TSLA, not giving any updates to the public, making no effort to do any marketing and stop communicating to investors. Why would he shoot his own foot? Why would BtV do this? It's a startup that (allegedly) built their ecosystem and shop around the NXC. With many more games to come (allegedly). Their shop is their sole source of income? So why let the token that is inteded to be used to buy things in the shop depreciate in value this much?  The answer is simple: It's a money laundering scam. They used the ICO to wash dirty french money and cashed out into their own pockets. Used a startup they call B2Expand as a front. Build a cheap ass game with their family members. Don't put any money into marketing or advertisement. Hire amateur devs and a useless marketing manager that probably got paid in now worthless NXC. Main goal is keeping most of the ICO funds. The NXC token themselves? They dumped it for BTC. Now they wait for it to get delisted from last two exchanges and declare the project failed. Move on. New project. New ICO. New money into their pockets. New scam. Rinse and repeat.  If someone in France is reading this. They should alert the authorities and the french SEC.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello there,  For the ones who wonder what kind of game Beyond the Void is, it's a new hybrid strategy game in space. It brings the MOBA genre with its RTS origins back together in a 1 vs 1 space war. It's free to play and downloadable on Steam in early access since october 2017. I invite your to try the game here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/700570/Beyond_the_Void  The official release is scheduled for October 24th, 2018, on Steam. Check this article published by CryptoGamer Community to know more: https://www.cryptoandgamers.com/single-post/New-blockchain-game-on-Steam-Beyond-the-Void-on-its-way-to-Gamescom  To reply to your comment, our game is a moba/rts, it's not the type of game that you can develop in one week or even in one year with only one dev. Our team has been working hard on the last two years to develop it. Now the early access period (1 year) draws to a close with an official release on Oct 24th, 2018. We're proud of the work we've done designing this game. I agree that those figures on steam charts are not the best ones, far from here, but remember that we're still in early access. This situation is usual for an early access game in the indie community and can't be compared to already released games.  Since a few months the community is growing, and it will increase with the release. We've organized tournaments (https://www.toornament.com/games/beyond_the_void), we've been to games fairs to present the game, we've made several press release to keep the community updated, ... We keep going with those actions we'll increase their intensity with the release and after it.  Amongst our early players, some are new, some are following us since several months, they believe in the project even if the match making time is longer than expected and are eager to see the future of the game in the next few months.   As you may know, Beyond the void's business model is based on the sale of decentralized game items. Some alternative spaceship appearances and avatars are already on sale on the shop (https://shop.beyond-the-void.net). This is where the NEXIUM is used! The Nexium will be the only token used in the shop to buy limited edition game items.   We're currently going further by developing more than a shop, we're deploying a cross-gaming ecosystem, called Nexarium, designed around one coherent storyline using a pool of blockchain game items. The player will be able to bring his favorite spaceship inside several games in the Nexarium. For example, the Junkalibur game item can currently be used as a war spaceship in Beyond the Void, or simply used as racing spaceship in the runner game we’re developing.  We've been sharing the Nexarium project, where the Nexium token plays a strategic role, in our last speaker slot at the Blockchain Gamer Connect in Helsinki, 2 weeks ago. We're going to share more new about this cross gaming ecosystem at the Blockchain Game Summit on September 25-26 (Check the program here: http://blockchaingamesummit.com/). As organizer of this event, B2Expand "goal is to push for the creation and implementation of common industry practices in favour of players and thus build a collaborative market to make videogames more democratic." says our CEO Manon Burgel in the lastest press release (read more here: https://goo.gl/ZgG95K).   Follow our Twitters accounts for more news about: - Beyond the Void game : https://twitter.com/BeyondVoidGame - B2Expand studio : https://twitter.com/B2Expand?lang=en  We hope that this update with links to tangible projects will give you the information you were looking for.  Best, B2Expand team

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Fezington, you predicted Bittrex, not Poloniex, unlisting last February 2018. So nothing in your stament is right actually. You have been trolling this channel for a long time now, this much is true. Don't you get tired of endless criticism ? If you don't like this project, I gathered this much, please leave. You don't need to warn people about anything. People on Bitcointalk are not children, they can decide for themselves if they want to be part of a project or not. I suppose that my message to you will only fuel your imagination for more posts, as it is often the case with trolls like you. And don't get me wrong. We like constructive criticism, and questions. Just not the insulting way you do it.  For people from our community:  We’re sorry to see that Nexiums (NXC) will be unlisted from Poloniex on August 2nd. We part in different directions, but we think it is fair to thank the Poloniex team for the support they gave us from December 19th 2016 up until now.  Poloniex changed direction, and NXC low volume of these past months is probably the main reason behind this decision. We're still listed on Bittrex, HitBTC, Openledger, Etherdelta.  It is right that while we gave consistent updates about Beyond the Void, we didn't communicate too much on our crypto side, and the NXC itself. We are going to change that, and it begins now.  I can already tell you that we're developing a brand new Dapp using Unity, ERC-1155, and we found a way for our users to pay their transaction fees in tokens (so no double currency in gamers wallets). The first version is scheduled to be released this September for the Blockchain Game Summit, that we are also organizing by the way. This event will gather 350 people, 30+ speakers, 20+ conferences, all focused on Blockchain & Gaming. It's happening this September 25/26th in Lyon, France.  Apart from that, we are officialy releasing Beyond the Void in October, and will announce the development & release of another game in the coming weeks.  If you didn't get the chance yet, you can visit our website. Beyond the Void website was also retaken entirely and will be released in the coming days.  We're a team of 16 people full time, we are over motivated and passionate about gaming and blockchain. In the real world, product development based on a brand new tech takes time, whichever the amount of money raised for the project. We're here, working, and we'll get there.  Stay tuned !

Author: The Bitcoin Co-op
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: It's not a scam just because the price is down... the whole market is, really. There's a wide variety of evidence of the game's existence to suggest it's not the result of foul play, here. They are partnered with Steam and the game is probably going to be released as promised. Many people have played it.  It's true that the tokens should be more integrated with the game, but that is the case for all of their competitors for the same reason: video game distributors and platforms are enforcing this. Spells of Genesis had to remove BCY from their app, Age of Rust followed suit with RUST, and War Riders was forcibly removed from Coinbase by Apple. So until the issue is resolved, they're not at a disadvantage in their niche

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello everyone,  To answer Doctor Nadir and the community, the important thing to remember is that the Nexium is the Nexarium's token. There is more information to come about the purpose and future of the Nexarium ecosystem and platform. We can't say it doesn't bother us that the coin isn't used but we understand why it isn't so at the current state of the project (as the Nexarium isn't operational). We truly believe that with the development of the Nexarium, communication campaigns, evolution and release of Beyond the Void, the development of the second game, development of B2expand activities and reputation, Nexium will finally find its purpose and will be used in our ecosystem for many games. It'll be both profitable for crypto enthusiasts and crypto gamers and accessible for more "standard" gamers that don't know anything about blockchain (or few).  To understand why we don't communicate directly about the nexium you also have to take into account the fact that regulations toughened.  We understand why you feel unhappy about it as you were used to more communication before and following the ICO but we now focus on building necessary games and tools so that we can implement and promote Nexarium and use the Nexium.

Author: bitcoinmaster1
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Honestly, If the money I invested in this platform went south, well it was already reduced to near that so I'm not upset about it.  But there is something of legitimate concern that has yet to be publicly addressed by the team.  Trading volume.  Afaik, Bittrex has a minimum average trading volume threshold that must be met otherwise that leaves it susceptible to delisting. If delisted from Bittrex, holders would have to move their coins elsewhere. The other exchanges still have limitations for a percentage of those people.  Which in its worst case, their tokens literally become quite useless without a market. I won't comment on the game. I haven't played games for years. I stayed for the integration of a platform.  However, if your market to have your tokens is gone, there's no adoption, there's no platform, there's no anything.  I half lie, there's a company who now has a harder task on top of what they already have to face, because their tokens/involvement in blockchain games/crypto space has been wiped out.  I said this once before, I don't mind innovation & staying patient to watch things develop. But I have watched this organization not respect the space they were entering and this is another example of it: as far as you've communicated with us.  At this point, you're better off asking for community help to build your platform since the current strategy is about to near wipe you out altogether, and everyone move on to Gamecredits or the likes.  Please stop disrespecting this space. It's burning you. And I'd hate to see what you lose from that. I may lose a little bit of bitcoin. But you have more to lose than I do. I can make that back.  So let's see what the team does.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi,  The Nexium token is going to be at the core of the Nexarium ecosystem. As the Nexium is an ERC20 token based on the Ethereum blockchain, the ecosystem we're creating will operate on Ethereum blockchain. We will not develop a new blockchain for this project.  The Nexarium portal is a decentralized cross-gaming ecosystem for developers and players. There you will find: - games: first one Beyond the Void now on Early Access on Steam ; a second game with game mechanics based on the Ethereum blockchain is actually under development ; and more games to come  http://store.steampowered.com/app/700570/Beyond_the_Void/ - blockchain cosmetic game items: Beyond the Void game items are already available on the store in limited edition https://shop.beyond-the-void.net/ - open source Ethereum tools to empower players and game developers

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello FFI2013, what do you mean by rankings?  Hello usmanov123, two patches are scheduled, one in may and one in june. There will be a new interface for the lobby, updated spectator mode and balancing. If we don't run late, the second patch will bring the 4th mothership and the third spell class.  About communication, community events and marketing: we'll release some articles about the lore, do at least two other tournaments and we're contacting press for the release and for some previews in June!  Concerning short term, Camille is going to Kiev at Crypto Games Conference to do a talk about "how to create a relevant user experience for crypto gamers". The topic isn't related to Beyond the Void but to the second game project that is currently under development at B2Expand. She might present some mechanics and explain how this second game integrate blockchain inside its user experience and game design! We may reveal more about this second game later in Q2 or Q3 2018.

Author: Alextheac
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi, devs. Share the news about the project? By the release date of the second game? What are the news related to the development of Nexium, new partners or ICO? You work hard, but write very little about this topic. We miss the powerful news

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi Alexheac,  About Beyond the Void: We're pursuing game development. There is a patch release on may 23rd. Among other things there are a new interface for the lobby and menus, hotfixes, minor gameplay updates and an operationnal spectator mode. Another patch is scheduled for the last week of june and should include the 4th mothership and a new set of skills. By the meantime we intend to do two community tournaments. We're also preparing the communication campaign for the period around the release.  About the second game: We can't tell you about the release date or the name of the game yet. However Camille showed some gameplay and presented the concept during Cryptogames Conference in Kiev last Friday.   About B2expand: Company website has been released: http://b2expand.com/. Team is growing and we're leading different projects. Most important and incoming one is the Blockchain Game Summit in September in Lyon.     About Blockchain Game Summit: Date: september 25th & 26th Location: Musée des Confluences, Lyon, France Website: http://blockchaingamesummit.com/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/Blockchain_Game  B2expand intends to gather both video games industry actors and blockchain industry actors. Ubisoft will meet there to lead the way for the future of video games. Thirty+ conferences and ICO pitches from the top-notch companies in blockchain and video games will be presented over the two days. But the Blockchain Game Summit is not only designed to inspire but to experiment as well! Panel discussions and workshops will thus be proposed to the participants who wish to deepen their understanding of blockchain or game design. During the two days, attendees will enjoy playtests on our partners stands in the main hall. To close the day in style, you will be invited, if you wish it, to visit the permanent exhibition of the Confluences Museum, which opens its doors for us from 4PM to 6PM.

Does this bother you?  With respect, your community. (Alextheac @Doctor_Nadir)

Author: vertikus
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: sorry to say but this project is not interested in the crypto side of their work. I was patient and was observing the recent developments since beginning of the year and I have to admit that the overall progress ( mainly crypto) is slow. Even if we don't speak of the price ( which is falling through major support lines and is about crash further) you failed to attract more players and crypto investors to your game/store etc.  Your communication channels are very inactive: You gained 7 new users on Reddit in the last 2 months even though I can see you restructured the subreddit. There is not a lot of communication on discord (mainly devs, admins and madfox) which is becoming an echo chamber without any interest. Even your bagholder eseses has left BCT after he sold for breakeven. Not many people playing the game according to Steam statistics either.  Another criticism is the roadmap which got delayed for weeks before suddenly being revealed. Not very professional imo. Fails like that cause harm in crypto space! Don't give dates if you can't make it in time! The roadmap itself mainly contains updates, new upgrades and models to the game itself. I hate so say it but that's not interesting for investors. Also I see that you mainly tour around France (Lyon) to promote your game which will attract French gamers but has no effect on the worldwide market.  The shop: It looks very good and works fine. Not many items yet but I guess it will change in time. I also like that you introduce new characters and storylines. There are not many people buying the items as there are just a handful of people playing this.  I have to say that I'm close to closing my investment in this project as the crypto side of the whole game is just not very profitbable anymore. With this small volume it is even a big risk to be fully honest. The full game release itself will be at the end of the year which is an extremely long time in crypto. It's sad but true as cryptocurrencies rely and live on news. I don't see a lot of attractiveness for outside people to invest in Beyond the Void.  I understand that Beyond the Void is a game and the focus is mainly on the game development side. I wish of luck for the future but I already lost too much on this and don't see the upside!  best regards

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello wgd!  The main game is evolving as fast as we can. Actually we held a closed patch test on Saturday 10 and Sunday 11. We are carefully fixing the version 0.5.0 of the game because it's one of the most important since the early access release. This version will be released during the last week of March. It sets up the basis of the final gameplay and renews the in game User Interface   In April tournaments will start again and we'll start advertising the game firmly in the gaming community at the end of April / May   In addition, I can tell you that an experienced game designer will join us to work on Beyond the Void at the end of this month. We took time to find a skilled person to take care of Beyond the Void and future B2Expand games

Author: MaoloSam
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Does the project benefit from being on the blockchain?

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello MaoloSam,  Beyond the Void project has been financed through an ICO (Nexium token). It was the first ICO made in France. So yes this game project definitely benefits from being on the blockchain. The game itself is not on the blockchain, but the game items are blockchain assets. This means that you really own your in-game items and you have the opportunity to sell them back on our second-hand market.  The Nexium token is going further than Beyond the Void project. This token is going to support the Whole Nexarium exosystem. A gaming exosystem powered by blockchain, where you can access all your Nexarium Games, Shops, and tools. We will tell you more about the Nexarium portal soon

Author: luzakos_yex
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Patch Note 0.4.7 - Winter Event 20 GRUDNIA   - BEYOND THE VOID   WINTER EVENT: THE WHITE NEBULA EVENT! A supernova has just exploded Beyond the Void, leaving a white nebula in its wake across the galaxy. Thankfully the Archbaron has produced an ambrosium aura, protecting the planets from the white nebula and preserving their existence. We added some visuals in-game and bonuses for the White Nebula Event: - Gifts, snow, and glitter in space and in the lobby. - +20% Battle Points at the end of each game. - Earn a special edition holiday title for winning two games (ranked) while defending the galaxy from the white nebula! This event will end on January 3rd. Enjoy Winter!  SHOP AND GAME We updated our way to log in to the game. Now you have one account to log everywhere: in the game (regardless of the region) and in the shop. This way the assets bought in the shop will be automatically available in the game.  LOBBY The lobby has been improved, you can now see news, last patch note, event, skills collection, tutorial, etc...  TUTORIAL (PART ONE) We finally did the first part of the in-game tutorial! Now you have the opportunity to learn more easily the basics of the game.  BATTLE POINTS Now you earn Battle points (BP) at the end of each game against a player. This BP can be spent in-game to unlock the free to play content. You are now able to unlock new skills with your BP.  EXPERIENCE You no longer gain XP with rings. Now you gain XP when destroying stuff: Ship, motherships, War tower, etc....  NEUTRAL CAMPS All camp have been reworked now with the new system. They will receive a visual update soon!  SKILLS All skill have been reworked! You can see them all in the lobby now in the “Collection” tab. Most of the skills can be used on structure now (turret, war tower, etc). Mark system We reworked all the skills and introduced the “mark” system. How does it works? Each skill is based on one element: Fire or Cryo. Each skill applies one (or many) mark when you hit the enemy’s mothership. If there is enough mark of a type on the enemy’s mothership, the skill will consume them instead to do an additional effect.  Scaling Now all the skills are scaling according to your level. To make it simple: you will deal more damage at level 15 than level 1. In a game, you can use [Alt] key to see the formula of a skill in the tooltips.  VISUAL UPDATES Wall-k2 received a light visual update. The War tower have been reworked and decorated for the “White nebula” event.  OTHER Now you can use a combination of keys in the settings to map your shortcut. All shortcuts have been reset. Echap now opens the setting menu. The fighters now spawn every 20 seconds (was 30 seconds previously).

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello everyone,  We are thrilled to announce our NxC Store development status as the Beyond the Void team gets ready for the New Year!  The game    Beyond the Void game released its brand new patch, including:  - Skills gameplay update  - In-game tutorial  - Battle points  - Content to unlock  - White Nebula Event for the winter holidays (12/20 - 01/03)  For more details you can read the patch note.  Your community feedback has been valuable for our team to develop and implement new features. We have since added game improvements for new players and welcome you to join our community on Discord.  As our player-base increases we will be putting more effort into advertising and growth campaigns to significantly boost our community. Expect exciting updates starting in February 2018!  Spend NxC at the Store     The Beyond the Void Shop comes out on January 10th!  Buy, Sell, & Trade Your Digital In-Game Assets  This is the birth of a revolutionary concept in gaming - true ownership of your digital assets. Everything you own in Beyond the Void also exists outside and independently from the game platform.  With traditional game platforms, you leave your winnings, skins, and any other game assets behind the moment you leave it. With Beyond the Void, your blockchain-enabled game assets such as your avatar, motherships, skins, and chests are 100% portable. Your items exist outside of that world, so the time you spend enjoying the game will translate to ownership of the things that make your playtime unique.  You own your skins and can do anything you want with them. Buy, sell, and trade them directly with other people, or put it up for sale on our own Black Market.  Introducing new features, with more in 2018:  - The Corporation Shop is where you can buy and own new items in Beyond the Void Note: Every time a newly created item is sold in the corporation shop, we burn half of the NxC received.  - A variety of assets: check out the latest mothership skins, avatars and chest available.  - True ownership: Your assets are yours. You decide when, where, and how to buy or sell a game asset.  - Come on the Black Market: Trade with other players, name your price and sell your assets. Buy assets that are no longer available in the Corporation shop. How does it work? If you have a Metamask account, just login and start trading! If you don't, create a shop/game account and a wallet with our built-in wallet feature. Then, buy assets and store them in your wallet as you wish.  - More free and premium content will be added on a regular basis thanks to the great work of the development team.   Introducing the Nexarium  The Nexarium is the ecosystem created by B2Expand to distribute products based on the same Ethereum blockchain technology.  Unique login  Your Nexarium account will be used to connect to all the Nexarium games and apps: Beyond the Void, the Store, other games that B2Expand will develop or publish etc  An ecosystem of games on Blockchain  As an indie studio, as artists, as gamers, we strongly feel that an ecosystem of games should have a consistency and an artistic direction to it. This is why we chose to develop and/or publish several games carefully chosen by ourselves. The new games should work well within the lore, the background, and the atmosphere of existing games like Beyond the Void.  We will announce new projects for 2018 along with the new BTV development roadmap released in January 2018.  Every new game published by B2Expand will use the same crypto-token, Nexium (NxC).  Having the games in the same Nexarium ecosystem will also allow cross-gaming of in-game items, meaning that the same item will be available in different games.  A more detailed post about the Nexarium will be published in January, in the meantime we wish you very happy Winter Holidays !  As usual, you can reach us on Discord, Facebook, and Twitter

Body: Sorry I was busy trading other cryptos which actually have a bright future ahead. This one is dead on all channels: - no regular updates - no news - no transparency (reports on expenses etc) - no activity in chats - bad decisions and no marketing - developers don't care about price, opinions or investors (they see themselves as indie developers and indie developers ONLY. they don't care about the crypto part of their job. ICO money was welcome though.Sad!) - team holds 50% of the total supply - no players (2 people playing this game currently) - no volume - no market maker - only one lousy shill (hi madcuck)  I wish bagholders good luck with this coin. I think one exit pump is possible before it gets delisted in ~6 months. I already marked this date for nexium on coincalendar and kryptocal. Even your cryptofriend Mougiyahar is losing his patience and downsizes the index weight. This should set off your alarms. So I don't see any reason to hold this coin longterm with this kind of behaviour and inactivity by the team etc.  This is my last post in this thread. I already sold a long time ago and made back the money I lost on this and even more with far better coins (nem, sc etc.) If you want to buy a game based coin then just buy GAME. They have a superior team/active community who actually take crypto seriously and notice when their currency falls and try to answer all crypto related issues with care and dedication instead of deflecting or doing nothing at all. Real professionals not like this amateur crew of imbeciles and incompetent fraudsters.  Good luck. Delisting season is coming soon.

This mobile free-to-play massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) bases its economy on an open market and trading between players using a cryptocurrency token called LordCoin (LC).  Active Games is holding an LC ICO to fund Lordmancer II’s development. The current price is 2376 LC for 1 ETH. As the ICO has only a few days left, they are making a free airdrop of 15 000 LordCoins divided among the backers of Beyond the Void’s ICO. The amount of LC you receive will be proportional to your investment in BTV ICO.  LordCoins will be distributed to the wallet address you created on the Ethereum Blockchain for the Beyond the Void ICO. So, no action is required on your part. If you are interested in acquiring Lord Coins, be careful to use the same Ethereum wallet you used for the BTV ICO. This way you’ll be able to receive an additional 10% of purchased LC after the end of their ICO. This offer is valid for LordCoin purchases from today till December 19, 11am GMT.  As a backer in the Beyond the Void ICO, you understand the real value of a digital second-hand market for in-game assets and true ownership of digital assets. Please give the Lordmancer team a warm welcome to the growing blockchain and gaming community, which we and our partners EverdreamSoft are committed to developing.  https://twitter.com/BeyondVoidGame/status/939174330952495105

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: The main difference between B2Expand and Game credit is the way we build the ecosystem.  In our vision, every game published by us is carefully tested by ourselves, and we chose each and every game we want to work with. We are not a platform for all the developers to publish their game, we have an artisitic direction in what we do. We know that players love lore, background in games, and the aim is to connect each game to the others through cross-gaming assets, and a shared marketplace.  So the result will be an ecosystem with less games, and more quality. It's not better or worse than Gamecredits, it's just a different way to see games Also, gamecredits, from what I saw, are little games, mostly on mobile, and while we'll probably do mobile games as well, we're more focused on the ecosystem story than game distribution platforms.  That's an interesting question, and I think that we ought to publish an article explaining our vision in more (and better) words. I'll focus on writing it before Christmas, and will probably publish it on Steemit, so I'll update you here when I do.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  Yes, I saw your question earlier and I meant to answer but got busy and other comments made it hard to see. Sorry about that. I'm not ignoring any question, I'm trying to keep up with all the things I have to do.  So now the answer:  Yes, the plan is to create an ecosystem of games using the same token, Nexium (NxC) and the same economic features (items exchange directly from the store, cross-gaming assets etc). The token we created has (or will have when the awaited store comes out) real functionnalities within our system. We'll use it for every transaction made in the store.  While developing Beyond the Void we are also thinking about future games, either developed by us from scratch, or published by us and developed by indie studios that we think are good. We're not worried about the funds, what we have left of the ICO will last at the very least a couple of years.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: On Bitcointalk, posters can't delete comments of other people, unless they are moderators of the forum which we are not. If your comment was deleted, it was probably deleted by one of them.  Screaming scam or failure here is not going to make it more true. If you don't understand or approve the team's choices, you are entitled to your opinion but flooding the thread with accusations can't be a positive thing in any case.  Ubisoft startup program is from September to January for all the startups in the program, this is official information that you can find on their website. However, the partnership we are building with people from Ubisoft will not die then. This program was never meant to push Beyond the Void onto Ubisoft marketing teams, or to sign any business deal. It is a great help for us in structuring the company and the project however, because they are great people with hindsight and experience about how to make a video game and manage a project.

Also in an older slack post their CEO said that "from now on they only have NXC to spend". Funds must be drying up as they sold a large chunk of it before the big crypto boom earlier this year. Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  An article came out about Beyond the Void  mmohuts, and I found it very interesting as well as very honest. It explains well why we need to polish the game before we can do broad marketing, and the positive thing is that all the issues the author talks about are know issues, and we're already working to fix them.  Here is the link, and a TLDR:  https://mmohuts.com/news/beyond-the-void-early-access-preview/  "As amazing as the framework is, the game is clearly still budding. Discerned from just a match or two, it’s pretty evident there are a few crucial updates to come."  "Similarly tough to tackle in the development cycle is the hurdle of getting players to stick around. Introducing someone to the game is easy. After all, the elevator pitch and pretty environmental graphics alone are notably worth the attention. But the more pressing issue is in convincing someone to come back again and again. Unfortunately, from my time with the game, each of my few-and-far between matches with another player came with a hefty thirty minute queue timer.  And it’s fairly easy to see why if taking my first hour is anything to go by. The lack of a proper tutorial and having a metric ton of information coming at you from all directions is enough make anyone dizzy."  "Furthermore, even when the in-depth mechanics are learned, matches don’t leave much of a lasting impression due to a distinct lack of excitement as a result of the gameplay. Take a big teamfight in League/Dota for example: they’re often accompanied with hard hitting sounds, dazzling visual effects, informative on-screen UI elements, and an epic announcer making the entire experience immensely exhilerating. I got none of that here. While I absolutely believe BtV will have its time in the spotlight – largely due to its innate marketability – I think some adrenaline pumping features embedded in the design is necessary for casual and competitive longevity. Of course, it’s in early access so it’s probably not high on the priority list, but it’s something that I feel is unmistakably missing when compared to the competition."  "Beyond the Void is an incredible foundation of something truly great in the works. Its well-executed concept showcases extensively thought out mechanics, eye-catching visual design, and the seamless blending of two distinct genres. I expect a lot from this game in the future, however, for now, most people may find it too early to get on board with. I myself will keep a close eye on this title as it gets closer and closer to carving out a sizable niche in the Twitch streaming and competitive eSports scene."

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  About the shop: to be really honest, we hope it will be released before 2018, we do all that is possible to make it in time. An Authentification server and app is not something trivial to do, it takes development time that we cannot shorten. We are not stuck at the moment, we make progresses, but it's still long. Good news is that once this is done, it will be done for all the other games we'll publish, and projects we'll develop. It's a one time work thankfully.  About marketing: I know that it takes time. I'm not saying we are not doing anything, on the contrary, I'm in contact with marketing agencies and influencers on a daily basis. The development sprint before christmas should add all the game features we need to increase retention, and I'm looking to start campaigns from January on.

Author: Alextheac
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Recently thread filled with a lot of the same posts "why the price is so low, everyone is to blame, because I bought NXC cheaply and I can not sell it in a week." Nobody forced to buy and did not promise that you could buy cheap yesterday and by magic get double rich in a week. These people don`t give any feedback regarding the quality of the game, don`t share their suggestions for improvement, bugs, etc. They are not interested in what the developers are doing, what innovations they want to implement, what meetings they are holding, what works they need to do some improvements in the BTV project. Well - hucksters are the same, they only have fast profits on their minds.  Regarding our project now:  I took part in the Ru-Tournament last Sunday. During the tournament twice I faced the problem of entering the battle at the stage of choosing perks. Exit the game and start the round again helped. Also there was an exit  in the midst of one of the fights, but I was lucky, it hasn`t bad consequences for my mothership. I hope that this will be corrected. I understand that Early Access is going on and these bugs are permissible and my competitors can experience exactly the same inconvenience. The game itself is addictive and does not tire, rounds lasting 7-15 minutes are comparable to a cup of coffee at breakfast. Rating in Steam, perhaps, reflects also my personal impression of the game for today.  I`d like to ask: 1) Is it possible to add to the game modes (or may be as separate game tied with BTV )with a global map of galaxies or star systems that can be attacked and defended by players, and this map can represent a variety of possessions of individual players, some of which will be pirates, some starry knights (took an example from your introductory cartoon )? 2) How about implementing a "weather" into the game - I mean -  meteor shower, black hole, white hole - these random events can increase or decrease players' resources. 3) Will you increase abilities of the Wall-K2, it seemed to me very weak and unbalanced. Maybe I just could not study it properly))

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  We're glad you like the project  Yes, it is possible to add game modes, and Madfox & co from the community actually thought about great systems (maybe you even took part of the competitive mode thinking ?). At the moment we're re-setting the priorities of development tasks, and we should have a lot more hindsight in the near future. I'll share the roadmap of future dev when we have it  About event cards: from the beginning, we said that we would implement event cards changing the map that would add gameplay depth. We actually did implement some during the open beta, but we found out that players were not enjoying them so much. So we are rethinking the design of those cards, and we add gameplay depth using other means - we're reworking the skills and the way to use them at the moment.  Wall-K2 was the strongest mothership not so long ago, and now it seems a bit weak. I guess it's a balance issue, and that the devs will correct it with the next update. If you are interested in the gameplay and stats, you can join our Discord to talk about it (if you're not there already) or maybe I could get the game designer to drop by here and explain a few things about game design, but they are pretty busy, you know, developing

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I don't see any correlation between keeping the price low - which would be dumb since I spend hours in this thread trying to decipher which posts are real concerns/questions and which ones are just troll posts instead of spending the same time being efficient on other matters - and "scaring" people out of the shop.  In a lot of games there is a soft currency used to purchase game items, and players are used to that. Prices of items will correspond to price of NxC, and I don't think any player will worry about this. It's impulsive buys, most of the players will buy NxC to spend it immediately.  And frankly, while we don't always agree with some of you guys from blockchain & trading, here on Bitcointalk and elsewhere, keeping the price low and making you angry is not the goal. This project couldn't exist without initial backers, and other members helping us on a regular basis (some of them daily).

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Yes that's the plan, creating an ecosystem of games using Nexiums. It will be both games that we develop and games that we publish. We have several leads, and it is slated to happen in 2018, but we can't share any news before a partnership is a sure thing otherwise it will backfire at us in no time

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi Vertikus,  Yes, we release the ranked games on Wednesday At the moment we noticed that we didn't have enough retention on the game because of missing feature, so we're trying to release those features as soon as they are developed to tend to that issue as fast as we can. In the future, we'll rather make big updates with a lot of changes, this way we can do marketing around the update to convert new players, and as an incentive for existing players to come back and check the game.  The shop is actually ready, like I said earlier, but we can't release it yet because we are missing the login feature. I know it sounds really silly, but the biggest workload at B2Expand at the moment is to make an application that can connect to the game, to the shop, and generally speaking to all other games that we will develop/publish. Not easy, considering each app has specifities and requirements the login app needs to respect. I don't know if I was clear in my explanations, I try my best  If you still have questions, please be welcome to ask them

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello eseses1989,  I am just coming back this morning in the office, because I was in meetings with Ubisoft in Paris all the day yesterday. It was very interesting, I met an associate producer of one of their big prod, and he had amazing insights of how a video game studio is managing its production pipeline and workflow.  Anyway, I went through all the messages that were posted here since last Friday, and I can understand if you are confused. People have very strong and different opinions, that's the least we can say...  Nexium is and will be a speculative token until the shop with in-game items is out. That's not really what we want, but we have no choice in that matter. What we can do however is to continue developing the game until it is polished enough to have a good retention rate, and to develop the shop as fast as we can. The shop is not the only thing we have to develop as a matter of fact, we need assets to sell in it. That's another big subject at the moment, creating good in-game assets that will interest players, while still being reasonable in development time. Once we got that, then we can let ourselves go on the marketing campaigns, and reach to a maximum of players.  Beyond the Void has a 73% rating on Steam, which is good for a game in Early Access. And it is a truly Early Access, not a disguised soft launch. Meaning that of course it misses features, in-game content etc. We are aware of that, and the players feedback, both on discussion channels and directly from our datas, is really important for us to keep going in the right direction.  About pump&dump talks:  I really have a few things to say about this. The first one would be that we said from the beginning that we would not share personnal addresses. When you buy a coin, you have to read first, and do your own research. That's why I'm always referring to the rich list, because I know that the founders have a significant amount of NXC for some of them, and that it can be a cause of worry. The second thing is to remind you that we had pretty big backers during our ICO (one has even more NXC than the biggest holder in the company, true story....), and that everybody is entitled to do what they want with their coins. Some of the criticism here is that we don't do marketing towards traders, for people in blockchain to be aware of Nexium. It's true, we don't advertise the Nexium so much, and that's because we are not traders ourselves. We use the blockchain for the amazing possibilities it brings, and we believe that value is brought by good work and products, not speculation. However, we will scale up the marketing for players once we are reassured that the retention is good enough.  I answered the best I could without falling into the endless spiral of comments that was going on here this week end and on Monday. I hope it is satisfactory for you. Otherwise, let's keep a healthy discussion happening here, or you can talk with us more directly on our Slack/Discord.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: RussaX: sometimes, fudders are coming back to fud a little more on this project. But if you look at the Nexium rich list, you will see absolutely no tangible movement of token coming from the company addresses... And the four founders don't manipulate the market in any manner either (of course we did not share our private addresses, so you can take my word for it, or not). It is quite useless to argue about this and anyways, if we wanted the money for ourselves and not do anything we wouldn't be here more than a year after our ICO.  Our token is not just for one game, we want to build an ecosystem of games, some developed by us, some by others (so we'll be publishers too), using Nexium as game currency. But you are right, the token price is completely linked to the project's success, as it should be. By the way, we're also thinking about developing other games very soon.  About Steam: it is great news for us that Beyond the Void is published on Steam, because they hold 99.9% of the video game digital distribution market and being released there has a great impact on our reach. A lot of video games have their own third party shop, it is not unusual at all. And it's ok, we can't make it work until Steam accepts Ethereum tokens as payment (they already accept bitcoin, why not Ether ? It's a gamble on the future that we are willing to take, because even if they don't add this payment method, our shop still works anyway).  When we did our ICO, it was to put the token in circulation, and to raise funds to start the project. Is the goal to spend every cent until the ICO money is finished in order to deliver our first product ? Of course not. We are thinking in the long term. We are thinking of ways to make revenue, with our games, with our Ethereum shop, with our skills so the company can last and develop itself properly. We don't want to sit on a pile of crypto, develop our product and be done with it. We have a vision.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hey there,  I didn't mean to sound like I was annoyed by questions, I am really not We are all getting frustrated by this shop that struggles to come out. All the teams (dev, marketing, legal, finance, everybody) in B2Expand want it to be out and running. NXC price doesn't concern us too much, it's true, but liquidity is important and in that I agree with you. It will prevent us to be unlisted from exchanges, and a healthy token should be liquid. We hope to achieve that with the store. Reddit is not really used in Europe, but I know that it is a top website in the US, so we'll try to focus more on that.  We don't share reports about our finances and expenses because we are a private company, developing a product to generate revenue, and we don't feel the need to report to the community the details of our business. We are as straight forward as we think is good for everyone.  I have a question for you guys: as you well know the company kept 15 million NxC for promotion and bounties. We spent a few million already for the ICO promotion. Back then, we had partners that accepted tokens as a payment because they were in the blockchain space already. Now, we need video games marketing, but PR agencies, marketing agencies with reach in the gaming community mostly don't accept crypto as payment and if they do, it's Bitcoin, not Nexium.  So the question is: how do we spend money on marketing, while avoiding to dump NXC on the market ? We never dumped tokens, and that's not the goal. Of course, there is still the ETH from the ICO, but then we are limited in what we can spend for marketing. Because we more than doubled the team, we plan to hire more people still to be able to deliver the product we think the community deserves. For now, we're ok because the crypto market is good. But we can't forget the risk tied to the blockchain tech/market.  I don't expect that you have the perfect answer, but I'd like to have your opinion. Cheers

Author: vertikus
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: That’s a hard question. What’s with the remaining ETH? Since your ICO the price went to the roof and should‘ve put you in a comfortable financial position. Then there is bcy... of course you should first and foremost try to convince partners of the benefits of your token and potential. Ultimately you have to make the call.

Author: vertikus
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I don't think you understand. It's an early release and even with a finished product "polishing" will be needed in form of patches, updates etc. should we wait until every single fix has been implemented until marketing starts? how do you even define the term "marketing"? It's an ongoing progress which at the moment is toned down. It's not "making noise for the sake of making noise". Advertisement and other efforts are very much needed now for the sake of the whole game experience because players are waiting 30-45 minutes to play a single game! And that (player numbers) my friend is not a thing which can be fixed solely by "polishing" Have a look at this for orientation: http://steamcharts.com/search/?q=beyond+the+void  Update: I waited 21 minutes this session.

Author: chilly2k
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I don't play games (Last time was Mario).  If the lack of players is part of the perceived problem, then there should be more advertising/marketing.  If it's because people are playing and not enjoying it, then the game should be fixed first.  Of course you don't wait till it's absolutely perfect.   But if you jump the gun and get a lot of people interested and then let them down, they will not be back.  Doesn't matter how good you make it.  I know your not going to please everybody, but I would leave it up to the designers to make that call, they have a lot more experience then I do.       Plus hopefully they are being mentored by Ubisoft, and have very good behind the scenes guidance.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: See, this discussion is really interesting, because that is exactly the kind of questions we ask ourselves all the time. Should we do more marketing ? Yes. But at which cost ? We can't wait until the game is fully "polished" before making noise, in that we all agree. Otherwise, we'll have a great product with nobody knowing about it !  But on the other hand, the retention at the moment is really not good enough, and we think that even if this is an ongoing issue for all games, we can make it a lot better in little time. So why not wait a little bit longer and make our budget worth its spending ?  About the ETH question: yes the eth price went to the moon since we did our ICO. We had to spend a lot of them before the price went up though, so we don't have as much as if we spent nothing in December, January, February, March.... But still we have a nice decent budget to make this adventure happen. We need to prepare in case the market goes down though, we can't be careless and spend dozen thousands $ in marketing, especially since we have the NXC from the ICO dedicated to promotion and bounties.  So what we decided for now is that we wait until devs implement at least game points and ranked games, and in the meanwhile we do small tutos in the new lobby page that is upcoming. While we do that, Camille, who is working full time for B2Expand and has a degree in marketing, and myself (Manon, cofounder), will plan a marketing strategy for December, January, February. We will ask Ubisoft to help us on that matter too, I'm sure they have great advices for us. By the way, I also requested the help of a data analyst from their team to help us understand and implement the right things at the right moment.  It is going forward guys, I know sometimes the project seems still from the outside, but from the inside everyone is running and working as hard as they can.  EDIT: I just tweeted a little survey about marketing budget https://twitter.com/BeyondVoidGame/status/930773832352370688

Author: vertikus
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Ok that's fair. Ofc this raises the questions: when will these ranked game be implemented? Also GP: what do players use it for? Leveling up?  Have you decided about your NXC which are allocated to promotion? You said that market selling them is not your goal so I'm interested to hear if you're going to convince Partners of nxc potential value.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I did not say the goal was not market selling them, I just said that we didn't want to dump. Reasonable selling at some precise times is an option. But yes, we would like to spend as much as we can without selling them. Actually, when we work with another company (last tournament for instance, video editing, musics etc), we always ask to pay with NxC and I'd say that it works most of the time. We didn't work with very big agencies yet though, so we shall see what they will accept or not. We're already working with a press agency accepting Bitcoin.  Game points, or battle points as we will call them, will be used to unlock in-game content. This content will be different than content from the shop though. You won't be able to unlock the same content with battle points than you could by purchasing with NxC.  Game points and ranked games are being tested today as a matter of fact. So if everything is good, we could implement this pretty soon, maybe next week.

Quote from: vertikus on November 14, 2017, 09:43:31 PM Quote from: chilly2k on November 14, 2017, 09:08:05 PM Quote from: Cryptotalker on November 14, 2017, 08:55:09 PM Well - i go more with the "polish the product first" theory. Too many people will take a look, leave and never come back IMHO at the current state.  Is it already possible to gain in game points? It's an ongoing progress which at the moment is toned down. It's not "making noise for the sake of making noise". Advertisement and other efforts are very much needed now for the sake of the whole game experience because players are waiting 30-45 minutes to play a single game! And that (player numbers) my friend is not a thing which can be fixed solely by "polishing" Have a look at this for orientation: http://steamcharts.com/search/?q=beyond+the+void  Update: I waited 21 minutes this session.  I fully understand, i played the game and i know i would not comeback. I will only check the game again regular cause of my crypto addiction. If you start a big marketing campaign and many people join at once, your waiting times go down to lets say under a minute just to increase for a minute every day becaucse more and more people leave.  IMHO you speculate on a short time rise in NXC price to sell, nothing else.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Beyond the Void Game Statistics  Original post here: https://www.beyond-the-void.net/wiki/beyond-the-void-game-statistics/  Hello everyone,  Now that we have more statistics about players, we thought it was a good time to share a short analysis of the data we gathered on Beyond the Void during this first month of activity (from October 8th to November 8th).  More than 6000 accounts were created, most of them after downloading the game on Steam. We effectively reach to players, and we can now speed up the game improvements based on the data we gathered from them. Amongst those account creations, 25% are created in the USA, 7% in France, 7% in Russia, 6% in China. With downloads in more than 63 countries in the world. Our international community is growing! The gaming events we organized (Great Nexium War, Early Access launch at the Meltdown gaming bar, etc.) are effective: They attract players, and there is a good correlation between the number of downloads and simultaneous players online. At the moment, only a quarter of players are coming back to the game more than once.   These numbers show that B2Expand succeeds in converting new players worldwide to Beyond the Void, with the major part of our community in the USA. However, too few are staying in the game at the moment, and that we don’t have enough players to lower the queue time significantly.  To optimize marketing costs, we need to improve our retention rate before starting large marketing campaigns.   Conclusion and next steps:  Making short tutorials available from the tutorial tab in the lobby. We will also make an in-game tutorial, but as it will take more time to develop, GIFs and bullet points are a good start. This work will help players to understand the basics of the game in a snap. Add in-game content to improve player engagement such as ranked games, game points, items to unlock, etc. Increase our conversion efforts to lessen the queue time and get data for further improvements in the game.  Beyond the Void is in Early Access and not fully developed at the moment. We are missing content and gameplay depth. Therefore, our efforts towards conversion should aim at an engaged community of players ready to follow the project and help us improve the game.   See you in December for the next stats update! In the meantime, follow our progression on Twitter and Facebook, and reach us easily on Slack (blockchain oriented) or Discord (game oriented).

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: It is possible to do marketing and development at the same time, and that is what we are doing. We are just saying that marketing should adapt to development. At this stage, features for broad adoption are missing, however, it is a great project for players who like getting involved early in games, and help with their feedback. Reddit is used in the US, but in France nobody knows about it. Medias are different in some countries. We should do more reddit, though, but we shouldn't make assessments on how well the community is responding looking at one media channel.  We're not publishing reports on the funds we have left from the ICO or otherwise. We said we would share information about the game stats though, and we did. You know now where we are standing, development wise, and marketing wise. The features we are talking about, improving retention, are scheduled to be released soon, so it makes sense to adapt the marketing for the time being.  About NxC price: it is our concern that we deliver the product we said we would develop, and that everything is working fine. We are an indie studio, and it makes sense for us to do marketing towards our players. NXC market belongs to NXC holders. The whole plan is to make a great game, have players, and then the Nexium can have more use and liquidity.  That takes us to the shop development, which is a real question. What we can say right now is that the shop is developed and functional. But it is not enough. We need some additional features before it can be released, and some content too which takes time to develop as well. It should be released by the end of the year, but it is really difficult to estimate the time it will take considering that very few people in the world developed on the same technology (I don't know a running decentralized shop for in-game blockchain assets on Ethereum right now, if some of you do, please drop the link in the thread). At this time, it could take days, or weeks, but truly we won't know for sure before it's ready.

Author: vertikus
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Yes I didn't mean you haven't done any marketing at all. It's just very quiet on most of your social media channels and not many outlets or people talk about this project yet. So attracting new players who might get deeper involved proves to be difficult without the publicity. Fair in France Reddit might not be used that much but it's still important especially with all crypto fans worldwide going there second after going to the homepage/twitter or BCT thread. It should be more on focus especially regarding your international community.  The price and volume should be a concern. Low volume coins and tokens get delisted fast and the NXC market although it has massive potential is unfortunately very illiquid. THere have been projects before with dedicated developers, ongoing development and a great community who got shut out of Poloniex just because of low volume. Although it's sketchy and never explained it's their business practice. Don't take a listing on this exchange for granted. You put effort in it (and probably paid a lot of BTC to be lsited) so please don't pretend that the token price development is not a concern for you. When you talk of backers you talk about investors too. I don't mean to anger you it just has to be said.  The fact that you don't report about expenses or remaining funds is unfortunate but I guess we have to accept it. A lot of crypto start ups (Lisk, AMP etc) do it to show their transparency towards their community in real figures. So it's not uncommon and streghtens the bond between all parties.  I get the impession that you were getting annoyed by the questions about the store. Don't be. Again nobody except for obvious fudsters wants to offend you. The store is just the only news we can grip until a new roadmap has emerged. And let's not pretend the price won't be affected by it. Not every investor is a gamer and not every gamer is an investor. You have cater to both groups to be successful. Keep up the good work and let's communicate more.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  Some items will be limited, either in time of selling or in number. We sell them once, and after that people will trade them themselves in the exchange part of the shop. Event cards: we implemented some for the open beta last June, but we noticed that it was not working very well in terms of gameplay, so people wouldn't have much incentive to buy them. This is why we are re-thinking them at the moment. There will still be cards for the game sold in the shop. We are just redesigning them in term of gameplay.  In the shop the prices will be fixed.  Nexium price won’t change instantly after we fixed an asset price, so there is time before the price moves too much. If the Nexium price increase over time, the price won’t move as it is fixed. The assets all belongs a specific limited edition. We might sell another asset in the future with the same effects, and for a different price. This system will work because we only sell cosmetics in the shop. It doesn’t prevent players to have the real game experience, even if they can’t afford a specific skin or holotag. If players want to unlock a specific mothership, they can do it by buying a skin for the mothership. But they can either buy an expensive skin, or a cheap skin.  We can't control the volatility of the price. However, generaly speaking the asset prices should go up with the number of users, and the goal is that people get more and more collector/valuable assets.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  Yes, that's correct. Every time someone buy a newly created in-game item in our shop, the Ethereum smart contract burns half of the Nexium received. It's not the case when people trade just between themselves. You can trade back and forth in our shop too, in the "black market" tab.  The store is still under testing and will be released soon.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: TODAY, Beyond the Void is published on the biggest video game digital platform distribution in the world, STEAM.  From what we know we will be the first game with a crypto economy to be published there, and we are proud to be one of the pioneers company in this industry. We hope that other great Blockchain and gaming projects will emerge in the future.  We’ve seen a growing interest for the project these past months, and Ubisoft’s decision to include B2Expand in their Startup program at Station F, Paris, confirms it.  “When we discovered B2Expand was one of the first in the gaming industry to complete a successful ICO, we were eager to meet them to understand what they would do with the blockchain technology. We were also surprised to see what a great vision of the future of their company the Fab Four (Manon, Eric, Rémi and Maxence) were foreseeing. We think BTV could be the beginning of something big in the gaming industry.” Nicolas Pouard, Research Director at Ubisoft Innovation Lab  NOW, you are wondering, what are we going to do ?  Here are the next steps we need to take:  Publish our game store  While a beta version is online already, we’re aware that it doesn’t contain all the features and designs that are necessary to bring gamers attention.  This is why we are completely reworking it at the moment, including new features and great designs !  This shop rework will also include the implementation of backer’s blockchain in-game assets in the game, and the release of new game items for all players to purchase and exchange.  We’re close to release it, but we are not able to share a date with you yet. However, we will update our community on our progress regularly.  Add content and in-game depth to Beyond the Void  We already had great feedbacks from the community, and from Ubisoft on the game itself. We are working to improve the User Interface, and to add in-game content. Now that the core gameplay is stable we can develop new motherships, rework the skills, and generally speaking make Beyond the Void even more fun and addictive   Maxence’s patch notes are full of great info about the latest improvements, implementations and fixes. You can find them here  Reach out to players  Players need to be aware of Beyond the Void project! This is why we are planning to:  Relay on streamers known in the gaming community to put the word out about us Organize online tournaments, with prizes, focused on different regions of the world Organize live tournaments and events in Lyon, France, to stir up the local community Reach out to gaming press Set up social medias campaigns    Next events:  October 28th: Online 16 players tournament, global but focused on the US community  October 31st – November 2nd: Participation to the Blockchain & Gaming panel discussion in the Future games Summit, London, UK  November: French streamers will discover and share Beyond The Void game with their community during the whole month.     We plan to share with our community information about number of players and other statistics at the beginning of each month, starting in November.     Stay tuned to our Twitter and Facebook for regular news, and ask your questions on our Discord or Slack teams.

Ubisoft invited renowned expert William Mougayar to talk about blockchain at Station F.  https://www.ubisoft.com/en-US/careers/gcdetail.aspx?id=302678  2) William Mougayar announced the start of a project that has been a long time in the making: the William Mougayar High Growth Cryptoassets Index, based on the ICONOMI platform, with a symbol: WMX. NXC is at the 2nd place in chart.  http://startupmanagement.org/2017/10/05/announcing-wmx-the-william-mougayar-high-growth-cryptoassets-index/ https://www.coindesk.com/money-mougayar-business-blockchain-author-launches-cryptocurrency-fund/  3) B2Expand (Beyond the Void devs) selected by Ubisoft to be part of their new startup program specialized in future techs.  https://www.ubisoft.com/en-US/company/start-ups/station-f.aspx https://www.beyond-the-void.net/wiki/beyond-the-void-is-in-ubisofts-startup-program/  4) Intelligent people can try to predict the next stages.  Notes:  William Mougayar is the author of The Business Blockchain (Wiley, 2016). He is General Partner at Virtual Capital Ventures, an early stage venture capital fund, and currently on the Board of Directors of OB1, the OpenBazaar open source protocol that is pioneering decentralized peer-to-peer commerce, a special Board Advisor to the Ethereum Foundation, a member of OMERS Ventures Board of Advisors, an Advisory Board member to the Coin Center, Bloq and founder of Startup Management. He holds BTC, ETH and STEEM; and he is an investor in OpenBazaar, MediaChain and ChangeTip.  Ubisoft Entertainment SA (formerly Ubi Soft Entertainment Software) is a French video game publisher, headquartered in Rennes, France. It is known for publishing games for several acclaimed video game franchises including Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Just Dance, Prince of Persia, Rayman, and Tom Clancy's. It is the fourth largest publicly-traded game company in the Americas and Europe after Activision Blizzard, Electronic Arts, and Take-Two Interactive in terms of revenue and market capitalization.  B2Expand is the first French company to develop and edit cross gaming video games on the Ethereum Blockchain.    Intelligence is the ability to acquire, understand, and use knowledge.

Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I believe in cycles and technicals not necessarily your efforts. At the moment $NXC is oversold. That's a fact. Another fact is that you delayed the early access in june to streamline the process with your planned steam release. And now nobody knows when or if it will be released. People that buy shitcoins don't necessarily believe in it but just want to profit or catch a wave. That's why a lot of investors in your thread are pissed while the believers are shouting "good price to buy now" or "to the moon". Whether you sold fractions of your own coins or not ( I believe so though your team would never admit it.) I'm sure you knew beforehand that the Steam release would be delayed but didn't say anything to let $NXC pump near the end of September. You sold off the rise after that. I used to believe in your project but after my observations (market movements, late announced delays, failed steam release date, no news articles since may, no transparency, rare updates on your blog) I just hope to let people know about the risks they're taking when investing in your token.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Devs pumping, dumping, or whatever, are just that: beliefs. Saying it over and over again won't make it more true, but I would never try to convince you. I know that you don't want to be convinced. That's typically a troll behavior. We always welcome constructive criticism, but this is not constructive at all. This is me losing my time answering to your messages. Project is real, game is real. We have had press releases since May (I'm listing them right now, I'll share the list when I have it updated). We're active here, on Slack, on Discord, on social media. You are entitled to your opinion, but I just wish it was more balanced and that you would also talk about positive things about our project (there are many). You are not warning people about the risks. People in the blockchain world know risks they take when they are backing projects, or purchasing altcoins. You are consistently trashing the project, and that's not a positive behavior at all, neither for us than for the readers of this thread.  To all of the other readers here: we are available for any questions you might have. You can ask here on Bitcointalk, or come to our Slack/Discord to discuss directly with us we are always happy to welcome constructive criticism and suggestions.  Slack: http://beyond-the-void.signup.team/ Discord: https://discordapp.com/invite/C7TqmaQ

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  This tweet was published by someone part of our community, not ourselves. We do not comment on the price of Nexium, and we don't give any investment advices either.  Beyond the Void is currently in Early Access. The steam release is under review. The steam store page is online, they are reviewing our build at the moment. Our business model for this game is cosmetic assets sold in our store. The model is similar to League of Legends, although we are not on the same scale speaking about number of players and popularity. Esports and competitive games market is growing, but again, we're not commenting on investments. We wouldn't dare to deliver a statement about market growth.  About our store: it is based on an Ethereum smart contract, burning half of the Nexium we receive when we sell a newly created item. Note that while the first version of the shop is online, a brand new version, really improved, will come out this month. We don't know the specifics yet, we will publish updates when we have them.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello guys,  Some news.  We are launching Beyond the Void Early Access in France on Saturday with a live event in Lyon featuring mythinX Trinity. https://go.twitch.tv/mythixtrinity She will be at the event, talking with us, playing, and all of this will be filmed and streamed live.     About Steam:  When we submitted the store page for review for the first time, they sent it back and we had to make some modifications on the page to comply to Steam terms of use. Now our Steam store page is online    We also sent Beyond the Void's build for review, and it also came back for compliance reasons so we won't be ready on Steam tomorrow. It should be soon, but we don't want to publish a date and postpone it again should it take longer. Thing is, the store page needs a release date for the build.... So we'll put it farther away and hope that the game will be released on Steam sooner.  On a (very) positive note, Steam is aware that we have a third party shop and they are allowing it, we just have to remove the Store link from the game's lobby. This is because they don't want Steam users to go directly on a third party shop from their app. Players will have to come from a web page to access the store, and we have no doubt that they will find it should the game be successful.

"and we have no doubt that they will find it should the game be successful."  What does this even mean?
