Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Alright, guys, here are some answers:  Yes, a lot of games have third party shops like Warframe, the studio Frontier, and many others. Not every game wants to make all its transactions on Steam, for various reasons. We are not the only ones, by far. We have other ways to advertise our shop than our website. Players are used to free-to-play with shops. Nothing new here.  All the transactions will be made in NXC in our store, that's the point. Beyond the Void items won't be sold elsewhere. Items won't be sold on Steam until they implement ERC-20 tokens as a payment method (on a side note, if we ever decide to do that, we would just burn the corresponding amount of NxC. But that's not the plan for now).  If Steam didn't accept third party shops, we wouldn't be on Steam. We would have to distribute the game somewhere else.  A reminder of what we do:  - we enable a second-hand market for players using our store based on the Ethereum blockchain - we burn half of the NXC we receive every time we sell a newly created item in the "corporation market", which is the official BTV market (this is a smart contract on Ethereum) - we plan to enable NXC purchase for fiat currency in partnership with a third party company, or several. We are working on this at the moment and can't share news about it yet.  About the steam store page: we HAVE to put a date, that's by design on the page, we can't publish it without it. And if the build has to me modified, it is postponing the release date.

Author: dodgrad
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Beyond the Void any official statement allegations, from fud posts above?

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I am becoming tired of fud and sometimes I forget that new readers didn't see my earlier statements about it   In short:  - We published the company addresses a while back, people can check that we are not dumping - Everyone from the team is busy working on the project, nobody has the time to manipulate anything - Earning our own tokens from manipulating the market doesn't make sense for us: better work hard and let the NXC price reflect the project's quality - We had pretty big backers during our ICO last year, some of them have bigger NXC stacks than we do personally as founders - As developers, we won't comment on NXC price. Traders do what they want, we have no control over it - We didn't spend everything from our ICO. We pay trips and conventions, that's true, and that's what is expected of us. We don't use Nexiums though, we use the Ethers and Bitcrystal we received last November. - We set aside 15M NXC for the company for bounties & promotion since the beginning. You can check this amount is not moving, but if we decide to actually spend some of it into bounties & promotion, well, it is also what is expected of us.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  This is the last guess we made about requirements, but it is hard to tell without statistics. We'll probably have more information once the Early Access is launched.  Gamepedia wiki is not up to date, to get fresh news please come to our official wiki: https://www.beyond-the-void.net/wiki/

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: To get feedback from players, please come say hello to our Discord. A lot of players won't come and post on Bitcointalk, it is not their channel of expression. https://discordapp.com/invite/C7TqmaQ  We've had great feedbacks on the last gaming events. Yesterday in Geneva, a kid even came back 7 times to play. He was not the only one, players said the game was good, and came afterwards to our Discord to keep track of the Early Access release. On Friday night, at the Arcaneum (a gaming bar in Lyon, France), we've had good feedbacks too. Sure, the game needs polishing, the balance is not perfect yet and we miss some content. It's all planned to be added and balanced in the coming months. We listen to player's feedback, and the game designers/devs implement the changes we need to improve the game experience. Even before the EA, we hosted playtest in our offices in Lyon every week on Wednesday evenings.  Bottom line is, we care about producing a quality game. On a side note, players liked the designs very much, so we're not worried about that. Maxence is a great concept artist, you can see his work here: http://www.maxence-burgel.com/

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  For us, it revolves around 2 principles.  The first one is to create a fair digital second-hand market for video games. People owning BTV game items have true ownership over them. They can exchange them within our shop without any additional fees from us (except the usual blockchain transaction fee), but also also outside BTV context as our assets are Ethereum ERC-20 compatible. Our shop is working with an Ethereum smart contract, and all the transactions are completely decentralized.  The second one is to create cross-gaming assets. As these game items are blockchain assets, so public & open source, anybody can choose to implement a corresponding functionality in their game or app. Of course, we try to develop partnerships with other indiegames to make it happen (we already have a partnership with Spells of Genesis, a counterparty based trading card game). We also plan to develop other games with the same background and to make a whole ecosystem of games using the same game assets, all exchangeable with our Nexium tokens.  So not only a player will be able to use his purchase in several games, but he will also be able to sell it back on the market.

Author: ox1337
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello guys! Really interested in the project.  Wondering if the 33mil NXC were burned or not?  And why is there an address with 50% of all tokens?

Author: fick nexium
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: true

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: What you see is probably the burning address, which is: 0x1b32000000000000000000000000000000000000  Since we burned around 33M with 66M remaining, it's showing that it owns 50% of NxC, which is a weird calculation because the total NXC created was 100M anyway. But that's probably the explanation you are looking for. We chose this burning address so nobody confuses the NXC we burned with anything else, and also because it has a nice red space invader on the Ethereum icon

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  What a nice load of comments over the last few days. B2Expand team is too busy working on Beyond the Void to think about trading NxC on Poloniex or elsewhere... And if you take a look at the addresses of the company that we published here on Bitcointalk, I'm pretty sure you'll see that no big amount of NxC have been moved for over 6 months. The small amounts gone were used to pay work done by people from our community, and several here can confirm this.  The one thing in all this I'd like to answer to is when some of you say we don't give news. We do. Every week, we keep you informed on our channels: Slack, Twitter, Facebook, Discord, Youtube, we regularly post on our blog, and on our wiki.  The last thing I'd like to point out is that we always read and listen to all the comments here and elsewhere. But posting insults or rude comments should be prohibited, here and on Bitcointalk in general. I'll systematically report every comment of this kind to moderators.  Sincerely yours

Author: RussaX
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: As with any indie game don't expect something epic straight away. It will be buggy, it will lack content and things will change from time to time while game is still in alpha. I did not had the chance to try the game while it was available so I can't tell exactly. Game did get the greenlight on steam because of crypto support so there is no way to tell it there will be any real interest from gamers.  You can expect delays, changes, fixes as it is normal with any indie game but that doesen't mean that game won't be successfull. Game can actually be very successive if devs keep good work, updates and listen the feedback. All in all no matter what happens nxc will grow on game release because more people will hear about it and there will be interest. I can't predict how much will it grow because it is too difficult to predict the market as it has suprises all the time. From my opinion there will be probably pump and correction after release and then you can expect steady grow as game continue to make updates and grow community.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello guys,  Indeed this is a pattern I've grown accustomed to. When NxC experiences price fluctuation, people are beginning to doubt everything all over again  However, September is a big month for Beyond the Void, and a good one because we will show most of the work we have achieved these past months of development.  From our ICO on November 2016 until now, we have never failed to inform our community of our progresses, sharing our news and our thinking on the development. It's on our blog, you can read it here and see our project's history, available in 6 languages: https://www.beyond-the-void.net/wiki/posts/ You can always come and discuss directly with us on our Slack: http://beyond-the-void.signup.team/

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: https://www.beyond-the-void.net/wiki/1059/  Early Access to Beyond the Void on September 27, 2017  Hello, Captain! I hope you’re ready to make your first expedition into space! On September 27 we will open the Early Access version of Beyond the Void!  We’ve made this version of BtV more fun and the UI better than ever! You’ll see how we’ve completely reworked the user interface, improving everything from the lobby to the game stats to building satellites.  And during Early Access, we’ll replace the last remaining mockups with improved graphic designs, and we’ll add depth to the game by supplying new motherships and skills.  Here are some of the things you’ll see in Early Access:    New lobby with a reworked Excalibur    New user interface    Satellite construction menu  In case you’re wondering, our Steam release should also happen in time for the Early Access launch. We’re certainly working hard on it right now and will update you when we have more news to share.  Updated mobile-friendly shop  Our dev team confirmed that a completely new mobile-friendly shop iteration will be available for Early Access!    Backers: You’ll be able to use some of your blockchain items in the game for the first time. Thank you all for your patience and support. We are very happy to share this preview version of our game with you.  We’re eager to hear your feedback! We want to hear your thoughts and feelings about the new interface design and gameplay; what your best strategies for winning are; how you discovered those strategies from the incredible range of possible strategies; what your favorite skills or motherships are … In short, we need all of your constructive comments to help us polish the game for its official release  Stay tuned on our social media and let’s have a chat there!  Discord: https://discordapp.com/invite/C7TqmaQ Slack: http://beyond-the-void.signup.team/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/beyondvoid/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/BeyondVoidGame Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD1IdjsnzXFdOarY20gMPQQ

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: We moved the Early Access date (for some good reasons)  As you might know from our timeline, Beyond the Void’s Early Access milestone was scheduled for release this week, on June 28th. However, given the following favorable conditions, we’ve decided to move Early Access to September 2017:  Because Beyond the Void was Greenlighted for release on Valve Steam, we are implementing additional Steam components in our game. For efficiency, we need to promote and launch the Steam and Early Access releases at the same time (instead of duplicating the effort for two separate events). With the rise of Ethereum’s value, we’ve increased the scope of Beyond the Void’s software development and community aspects. To fulfill these expanded goals, we’ve hired three people and need the additional time to bring those efforts to fruition. We recently joined the Lyon Game Lab, a video game studio incubator, gaining an incredibly talented and experienced group of mentors. As a team, we need more time to learn and apply the lessons they’ve shared with us.   We’re reworking our Marketing and Communication strategy to engage a maximum of players and create a growing community of Beyond the Void! In consequence, the beta will be closed between mid-july and the Early Access in order to organise private tests to polish our game.  Our team is always available to answer your questions.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Steam just green lighted us, but the game is not on Steam yet. We have some development to do to make it happen (implement steam components). To be fair our player's community is not that large at the moment, and we thought that timing Early Access with Steam release was a good idea. It also gives us the time to build the player's community more.  On the last beta version, we had a lot of beta testers during the various events we attended, and the conclusion was that the game's interface is still not enough user friendly. We'll have an update next week or the one after, but we wanted to take the time to test this new interface before releasing it to the public.

Body: Where do I get the Nexium wallet?? Thanks.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello,  Nexium is an ERC-20 token on the Ethereum blockchain, thus Nexiums are stored on Ethereum wallets. We have no dedicated wallet at the moment, but you can use any ERC-20 compatible Ethereum wallet. We recommend that you use MyEtherWallet usually, because you can see Nexiums natively there.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: We are not in a hurry to add the game to Steam right now. The important thing was to get the right to do so. The right to publish Beyond the Void on Steam does not expire. But before adding the game, we have to make sure that it is a quality game, meaning that every little detail should be polished. We are getting there.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Tournament rules  Tournament server: EU_West On Friday, May 19th at 7:40 PM UTC 150 NXC prize for winning the tournament Additional 50 NXC for the tournament winner if you also beat “the Boss”.    To enroll:  Download fresh game launcher here https://www.beyond-the-void.net/#section7 Send a private message to MadFox on our Discord with your in-game nickname: https://discordapp.com/invite/C7TqmaQ. Be on the Discord on Friday at 7:20 PM UTC, 20 minutes before the tournament starts.  To participate:  Check your opponent nickname here: http://challonge.com/5cfg0nhn. Launch Beyond the Void and add your opponent in your friendlist. Challenge the opponent to a duel.  Once the game is finished:  Take a screenshot of the Victory or Defeat. Upload it on Beyond the Void Discord.  If you won the first game, then wait for the second round to start, and repeat the process with your new opponent.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Nexiums are used in the game's shop, to buy & sell game assets. They are not used in game, as we want the game to remain competitive and associated to e-sports. The assets from the shop are blockchain assets, mostly vanity content and cosmetics. We chose to use the blockchain to provide trustful exchanges and true ownership to our players. Also, using blockchain assets allow us to do cross-gaming with other games using the same assets.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Gameplay Update  Here are the latest changes you’ll see with the next patch:  The planet conquest will change completely. Now, there will be three control points around each planet. To conquer a planet, players must conquer each point by staying on it for 3 seconds. The control points form a triangle that always points toward the sun. Entering a disputed zone interrupts the opponent from conquering a control point. If the opponent leaves the control point before they are done a, their charge from the control point diminishes slowly until it reaches 0. If you stand on a control point that was partly conquered by the opponent, you have to discharge the point before conquering it. If the planet already belongs to a player, it attacks the opponent when the opponent tries to conquer the control points. Conquering a planet destroys its rings.   Aside from shooting at nearby enemies, Planets can have skills that derive from the rings you’ve built around it.  Military ring: Fires on the enemy’s ships, causing zone damage. A warning circle appears before it fires so you have time to dodge. Industrial ring (previously called “economic ring”): Attacks the enemy in a large straight line, causing little damage, but slowing the enemy down. Engineering ring: When a planet has been conquered, this ring adds turrets to the control points.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Second Milestone achieved today !  Today Beyond the Void achieves the second milestone of the project. Our open beta is coming out in a few hours, at 6 PM GMT, and we are very excited to unveil our work to the world. We look forward to see many of you playing !  To all our supporters and partners so far, thank you from the bottom of our hearts. We now need to reach a maximum of players in order to make Beyond the Void a success amongst the gaming community.  You can help us!  We published Beyond the Void on Steam Greenlight last Friday, and would need as many votes as we can gather in order to be published on Steam. You can vote for us here: Steam Greenlight    You also can take a look at our brand new wiki: Beyond the Void Wiki From now on, all our news will be published there and we will close the Tumblr blog. You will notice that the wiki is also available in Russian !

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Last patcher notes before the Open Beta available on our blog:    Version 0.1.6 & 0.1.7  The patcher has been improved. It should work even better and fix problems for some regions. Mac users: Remember to drop your patcher in the application folder ! You will have to reinstall if you want to use the new patcher (recommanded) A bug reporter has been added in the lobby and the game. Now you can report issue and help us improve the game. Now you can see Debuff affecting you above your mothership. A new skill has been added: Fallback. Fix of all kind of technical issues on the game and the servers

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello guys !  Thanks everyone for all your support, here are some news:  We were added on Bittrex as you may know already    We have a new trailer:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKOnLI7AmY0  Another one is on its way, no ETA at the moment.  Here are development news from Maxence:  Version 0.1.5  New Content  We’ve added an advisor to help you understand the game. This is an early version. We’ll improve it along the way and will probably add a voice to it for the release. We completely reworked the AI. It has three levels of difficulty: Easy, Normal and Hard We’ve added Fusion, a new mothership. Animations for fusion will come with the next patch. When a player is casting some skills, you’ll see a casting bar over a mothership. When you die, you can buy back your mothership for 300 cubes.  Fixes & Changes  In this version:  The mothership bonus camp displays a visual effect on the mothership. The base research time has been reduced from 180 seconds to 120 seconds. The cost of research has been reduced from 300 cubes to 200 cubes. A minefield takes 2 seconds to cast. Mines last for 120 seconds. The game remembers the last mothership you were playing. The respawn time has been increased. The healing rate of the “Repairer” has been decreased from 50 to 10 hulls per second. On the minimap, your move/camera orders snap to big objects like planets, motherships, camps. This should make it easier to use. By default, the local map (top right) is less zoomed in so you can see a planet when you are on the edge of its territory. The AI of pirates from the “Space Pirates” card has been improved. Fixed some minor issues with creeps. You can click a planet “portrait” to move the camera to it. A damage marker has been added to the planet panel. Cubes are now displayed under your name (middle top). The “mouse over” ship & other entities should work properly now. The cursor turns red when you can attack a target or use a skill. The game shouldn’t disconnect a match any more. Fixed crashes & fancy bugs here and there.  Version: 0.1.4  Fixes and Changes  Now, by default, planets spawn 3 harvesters and 1 fighter, while the mother planet spawns 5 fighters. Harvesters gather a lot fewer cubes now. (The previous rate of harvesting was ridiculously high.) The “Space Pirates” and “Techno Singularity” events are working. The creeps damage and health has been reworked as well as their AI. The warp should work properly in every situation, and the “Warp loading” bug has been resolved. The bug that was preventing players from building rings on conquered planets has been resolved. Fixed several crashes on the servers.  New Content  A message has been added when a card is activated. Added the Mad rockets skill. Added the Gas Giant event card.  We are getting ready and polishing the last details for the Open Beta on Wednesday next week (May 3rd)  We created a wiki: https://beyond-the-void.net/wiki/index.php?title=Main_Page It should be available in Russian too very soon.

Author: bcmine
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: not that someone is going to sell too early:  Here’s our current Marketing schedule:  April 6th: Exhibition booth at Blockshow, Munich (Germany) April 7-8th: Exhibition booth and conference talks at CoinFest, Manchester (UK) April 9th: Indie Game contest and exhibition stand at Evry Games City (France) April 14-17th: Exhibition booth at Insomnia gaming festival, Birmingham (UK) April 22-23rd: Exhibition booth at Japan Touch Haru/Geek Touch Festival in Lyon (France) Mai 31-2nd: Exhibition booth at Norwich Game Festival, Norwich (UK) July 15-16th: First Beyond the Void tournament, details coming  soon August 23-26th: Gamescom 2017 in Cologne (Germany)  More events will be scheduled soon.

Author: madfox11
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: My small conclusions about this project. Well, what do we see now after a half of a year from ico? As for me – I look at this young game team and feel a joy ( and i`m a bit envy in a kind way), they keep going to the target, gradually gaining the confidence of the community. I remember evil suspicious comments and scammy cryings. Well, look around! You see billion Ico`s, greedy faces of mature `developers`, promises of new (or meganew) tech - and people keep bringing money to their projects. What do we see here? We see small team trying to combine blockchain technology and a game. It`s hard work even for large company. But I see right steps – team selected good Ethereum blockchain technology for token part of idea, they selected nice space subject for gaming part. They are working bees in this crypto-world. They are trying to introduce crypto in our real world. That’s great. They need to work here, there and everywhere to catch promised milestones. Just give them a chance, forgive some delays. Look at Eric, Manon, Remi, Maxence – they have to develop a game, but they`are flying around all these exhibitions trying to present project. In the same time they answer our questions, even stupid questions. They gave us some bounties. And look at us! How did we do our job? We showed our greed! We devided blog posts into four parts to earn more tokens, we posted short stupid articles just to reach the required limit of 300 letters. We exploded Manon`s brain – she had to read all this stuff. And she did it! Only few guys honestly made good reviews based on real game experience. I think we need to support this project by real deeds – we can make promo videos, translations, good reviews. Don`t look from the side – take part! Awake and understand - Beyond The Void team are real people making real game in a real world without help of `mighty uncle` - large game corporation. They did a lot and still on track. Good luck guys. Forgive me my `international english` emotions! :-)

Author: souljah1h
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: This could be big    Quote To participate in more events, we’ve adjusted the formal release date from June 6th to September 6th. To clarify, because web-based games don’t sell shrink-wrapped software, a release is a Marketing event, not a Development or Logistics event. For both developers and players, who continue playing the game before and after “release,” the concept of “release” doesn’t have much impact. We’ll be participating the whole Insomnia gaming festival in April, and also at the Norwich Game Festival in May. These are two big gaming events in Europe, and a great way for Beyond the Void to reach out to new players. We will also have a stand at the Japan Touch Haru/Geek Touch Festival in Lyon, in April and we are planning to participate in the  Gamescom 2017 in Cologne on the 23rd of August.  Here’s our current Marketing schedule:  April 6th: Exhibition booth at Blockshow, Munich (Germany) April 7-8th: Exhibition booth and conference talks at CoinFest, Manchester (UK) April 9th: Indie Game contest and exhibition stand at Evry Games City (France) April 14-17th: Exhibition booth at Insomnia gaming festival, Birmingham (UK) April 22-23rd: Exhibition booth at Japan Touch Haru/Geek Touch Festival in Lyon (France) Mai 31-2nd: Exhibition booth at Norwich Game Festival, Norwich (UK) July 15-16th: First Beyond the Void tournament, details coming  soon August 23-26th: Gamescom 2017 in Cologne (Germany)  More events will be scheduled soon.  The more the merrier

Author: Febo
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Quote from: Beyond the Void on March 22, 2017, 11:10:25 AM  The adjusted schedule is:  2nd milestone: May 3rd 3rd milestone: June 28th  Why? Our development schedule slipped by almost 3 weeks in January causing us to reschedule the first milestone, and we haven’t caught up since then. Considering the number of events the whole team is involved with in April, we are rescheduling the second milestone to avoid any timing issues. To reflect this, we’ve adjusted our schedule by +1 month.  Early Access  We’re changing the name of the third milestone to Early Access. During this phase, the game will be feature-complete and accessible full-time to players, as planned, but not formally released. During Early Access, we will respond to actual demand by gradually scaling up the sizes and locations of our game servers. This will make the game available and responsive to the growing player-base. Every bullet point on the Milestone will still be met.    Timeline was just a tiny bit modified. In crypto anything longer then 3 months is already to long.  If global launch will happen before December I will be pleasantly surprised.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Timeline update & news  Adjusted Development Schedule  Hi, Everyone. Here’s are some updates about our development schedule. We are pushing back the second and third milestones by one month.  The adjusted schedule is:  2nd milestone: May 3rd 3rd milestone: June 28th  Why? Our development schedule slipped by almost 3 weeks in January causing us to reschedule the first milestone, and we haven’t caught up since then. Considering the number of events the whole team is involved with in April, we are rescheduling the second milestone to avoid any timing issues. To reflect this, we’ve adjusted our schedule by +1 month.  Early Access  We’re changing the name of the third milestone to Early Access. During this phase, the game will be feature-complete and accessible full-time to players, as planned, but not formally released. During Early Access, we will respond to actual demand by gradually scaling up the sizes and locations of our game servers. This will make the game available and responsive to the growing player-base. Every bullet point on the Milestone will still be met.  Adjusted Marketing Schedule  To participate in more events, we’ve adjusted the formal release date from June 6th to September 6th. To clarify, because web-based games don’t sell shrink-wrapped software, a release is a Marketing event, not a Development or Logistics event. For both developers and players, who continue playing the game before and after “release,” the concept of “release” doesn’t have much impact. We’ll be participating the whole Insomnia gaming festival in April, and also at the Norwich Game Festival in May. These are two big gaming events in Europe, and a great way for Beyond the Void to reach out to new players. We will also have a stand at the Japan Touch Haru/Geek Touch Festival in Lyon, in April and we are planning to participate in the  Gamescom 2017 in Cologne on the 23rd of August.  Here’s our current Marketing schedule:  April 6th: Exhibition booth at Blockshow, Munich (Germany) April 7-8th: Exhibition booth and conference talks at CoinFest, Manchester (UK) April 9th: Indie Game contest and exhibition stand at Evry Games City (France) April 14-17th: Exhibition booth at Insomnia gaming festival, Birmingham (UK) April 22-23rd: Exhibition booth at Japan Touch Haru/Geek Touch Festival in Lyon (France) Mai 31-2nd: Exhibition booth at Norwich Game Festival, Norwich (UK) July 15-16th: First Beyond the Void tournament, details coming  soon August 23-26th: Gamescom 2017 in Cologne (Germany)  More events will be scheduled soon.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Beta session for backers: 48 hrs non-stop next weekend  Beyond the Void will open a Beta session for backers this weekend from 8 AM GMT on 3/18 to 8 AM GMT on 3/20.  The servers will be running non-stop for those two days.  To play:  * You have to be a backer. * Register before 7 AM GMT on 3/18. * Use this form to register: https://goo.gl/forms/Cstf76ZTFjPcapUK2.  Note: Backers are people who bought Nexiums during our ICO in November 2016. You cannot become a backer now.  Can’t find an opponent ? Come to our Slack !  Considering the limited number of backers, you may find it difficult to find an opponent through the game match-making system at some times. We recommend that you come to our Slack in #beta and find somebody to play with before launching the game.  http://beyond-the-void.signup.team/  Beta session for everyone: 3 hrs on Saturday 3/18, 3-6 PM GMT  If you are not a backer, no worries! You can still play next weekend, but you will have to play in the hours open for everybody.  To play:  * You do not need to register. * Create a gamer account using the PC or Mac game client.  Important information for backers and everyone  For development purposes, we deleted all existing gaming accounts. Even if you created a gaming account for the last beta session, you need to re-create it for the upcoming beta session.

Author: Cimmy_revenger
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: First Milestone February 2017  Game Beta for Backers  - Make sessions of the game available for backers to try it out and give us feedback. We may take the game offline between sessions so we can focus on fixing issues and improving features.  - Make the shop functional for everyone to buy and trade game assets.  - Migrate the game server to a high-availability cluster that can scale along with the growing number of players.  - Create the first level of content, such as essential items and cards, for backers to own and play.  - Link the assets wallet to the backer's account. Backers can see the assets they own in their wallet, and can use those items in the game.   Second Milestone April 2017  Open Game Beta  - Make the beta version of the game available to everyone.  - Offer welcome packages to early players.  - Grow our player community to over 1000 player accounts.  - Create the second level of content. The game must be rich and exciting to play, with many strategic possibilities.  - Complete a fully functional admin backend to manage the server cluster and player’s accounts.   Third Milestone June 2017  Game release  - The official game release to the public. Beyond the Void will be in continuous development to add new content to the game and on the market.  - Create the third level of content. You will find the items listed below in a couple of days.  - Make players' public profile and stats available, including their Elo rating, game stats, current avatar, title, team affiliation, etc.

Author: Mince1
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I would like to start off by saying, Thank You to the Beyond the Void team. And even more thanks to the person who has been dumping a few million into Nexium. I am writing this post to respond to the person who is attempting to trash Nexium because he isn't getting the return he wished for quickly. Let's think about this,... Now I am not a huge investor, I am new to the BitCoin market, I really don't know to much about how this all works; however, I am learning quickly. The Game comes out in June, so why would anyone think that there investment will have maximum potential before the release? Just a no brainer in my opinion.      So,Mr. Nexium who has dumped milions, I have been watching you since you came back in early January, very closely actually. I know when you are active, I know when you sleep, and I know when is the best time for you to pump NXC. I have been watching your patterns so close that when I have told my friends about your next move, and they made money. In return, these friends, who are a friend of a friend, lol, have decided to help me out because I made them money. They know I am a poor white man from Washington State, U.S., and they have decided to get together and help pump NXC to where it should be. I wish I could say when, but I don't know. All I know is that I bought 10,000 NXC literally right before you pumped NXC over $0.02 a share, I bought in at $0.019, and I appreciate everything you have done. Yes, I am making out pretty good with my pennies. I know you have been working long hours to build the Nexium shares, and I Thank You.      To the non-gamers out there. And I am kinda one of those non-gamers myself, although I have been involved with EverQuest for over 15 years now. In EQ, since the beginning, Gamers have been trying to make actual money playing the game, by selling items they have looted, or with the in game money Platinum. It is against the rules in EQ, and many other mmo games to trade, buy, or sell anything outside the game for money. What people don't realize, is that there is a huge demand to make money playing a video game. Millions of  people wish such a thing existed, and Beyond the Void is providing that option. Not to mention, that what I see in this game, is what Star Wars should have been when it came out a few years ago. You have created a "Brilliant" platform for doing so, and I think the BtV is something that people are waiting for.      To wrap this up, Mr. Nexium has at least 2.5 million to play with NXC, and the sooner, not later, would be a great time to invest. March will be good news, and will start to shine the light on the subject. So, don't listen to a person who only has money on his mind, listen to people who actually have an idea what the impact of this game will have. I have no experience in BitCoin trading compared to the whales, but I have a lot of experience with these types of games, and my experience says Beyond the Void nailed it. Good Job!

Author: Jumpy
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: This makes for some pretty good conspiracy reading. If everything you wrote is factual, just know that you are putting yourself in a precarious position. You have to hope that "Mr. Nexium" is a supporter of the project and not just an opportunist. (Maybe I'm jaded, but I tend to think he's the latter.)  If you think that he's just buying and holding indefinitely, you aren't thinking about his personal endgame. He either wants a ton of in-game currency, or he wants to turn a profit. Most whales in this space don't like to take a long time to cash in, too.  All of that said, just buy and hold NXC because you like gaming and you want more developers to consider true ownership and blockchains as they develop their game.  Whatever your motivation and situation, I wish you luck.

Author: Mince1
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: That is ridiculous, if you want facts, I bought in at $0.019, i really doubt that I will loose money from my investment. The numbers are already there, I bought in at the lowest price. I am happy making just a few hundred dollars, and I will roll that money, just like all the other coins, and continue to build my investments. As for facts, what facts are you looking for in a game that has 3 months before it is releaesed? Really, Pres. Trump may start a war, and NXC may never happen, it's life, thats the choice/risk we take when we get involved in things like this. As for the position I am in, I am in the green! Your negative response has no bearing on my money. I will not feed into that nonsense. And to be honest, I really had no intentions of playing Beyond the Void, but I think I will just to have fun. After all, fun is the name of Mr. Nexiums game. As for his investments, don't you think he would be a fool to not invest in his own creation? It's called protecting your interest. If he has millions already, how much do you think he cares about what the NXC shares are worth? It's a game! Just like trading Coins, it's a game, you win some, and you loose some. As for conspiracy, yes, I would like to conspire to make more money, Duh!

Author: Mince1
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Oh, I am happy with my little pen!$, lol. I am not a rich investor, but I am someone who is doing good with my pennies. Some people here are upset because they didn't make what they wanted to make. I was taught, very clearly, that if you wish to make money in BitCoin, to invest in the technology itself. So, when you buy into PotCoin for example, is that investing in the technology? Does that make the weed taste better? or does the weed help Bitcoin? Yeah, you invest in a game, it's the game that you have money into, not so much the BitCoin market, but an individual item. There is no need to be negative, or put any person or coin down because NXC isn't a money maker for whales. Whales are dealing with BitCoin, Ethereum, and so on, those Coins are for the technology itself, and they are getting paid because they know what they are doing. They are not buying into anything and everything wishing that it all pays off well. The people who are doing that are scavengers, bottom feeders, who are taking advantage of everything they can. And then get upset because they didn't really think about what they were getting into, it just sounded good at the time, right? As for me, I got lucky, I was just doing some shopping, looking at numbers, trying to find something that was about to take off, and I did well. So do I have a huge pen!$? Who cares, i got lucky! And just like the casino, you win big, or go home broke. Just like any of the coins out there, you have the chance to not make a dime.

Author: Jumpy
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Agreed. There is a pretty toxic aspect to this community being full of amateur wanna-be traders. Keep in mind that the most useful currencies in history have generally been stable and inflationary; basically the worst kind of asset to speculate on. With notable exceptions, such as BTC, usefulness and profitability have most likely been negatively correlated.  My greatest hope for NXC is that it becomes a useful way for people to exchange value across gaming platforms, not that it becomes the next big "win" for non-gamer speculators.  The signature campaign is a good example. It probably pays out a little low, but it's a progressive project worth helping out.

Chart: http://imgur.com/a/VGLxS  After our discussion, the price dropped already by -20% and continue falling. The next big news are coming in 2 months (April), there will be few months of nothing and a big correction, especially now when bitcoin is rising.  The online store looks ridiculous, it is absolutely non user friendly. Players won't buy ETH + Nexium to buy a game asset. There is no sense to have NXC at all, why don't use only ETH instead? That sounds pretty stupid that player need to purchase 2 cryptocurrencies to purchase 1 item in the store.  Please, thedreamer, don't lie to people asking to buy on high right before 2 months of continuos fall before the open beta. Shame on you! You are an active community member, so when you are lying to new investors, you harm the reputation of the whole BtV project.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: This is the shop's first iteration. While the features work, we understand that it is still not very user friendly. But we will improve this as we go, and for now we don't have players that are not aware of crypto so we don't think it is a huge problem. However, you are right when you say players won't buy ETH + NXC. Average players are not aware of crypto, so we need to work on this and propose a easy and user friendly way to purchase assets. We are looking at the moment for partnerships in order to achieve this.  Why did we create NXC: because we wanted to create a token specifically for a blockchain & gaming ecosystem. And because we don't want the price of the token we use to depend on announcement in ETH community. We want the Nexium value to depend on the quality of the products.  It is still early in this project, lots of things have to be achieved, we are aware of this. But, every thing is going great and according to schedule (or almost, we missed the shop's deadline by 3 weeks, which is nothing in development timetables).

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: NXC will be burned on a regular basis: Every time we sell a newly created item in the shop, we burn 50% of NXC we receive. When players trade their assets, no NXC are burned though.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: If people are worried about the price they need to pull out the length of time on polo and look at the longterm trend. It's honestly as perfect of a chart as you're going to get in crypto... Slow longterm growth. I think, yea, the bitcoin rise is preventing a serious breakout for a lot of coins, but NXC is a coin everyone is watching. I really believe that a whale  is accumulating for a push. I've been watching the charts really closely. We've had 3 instances in the past week, where NXC has looked poised for a serious breakout, only to get mysteriously pushed back down. I'm predicting another good bump when the MACD crosses over on the 4h. It will either be today or tomorrow as we approach the Beta release.  The fact that the team is on point, and ready to release this beta on time says a lot about this coin. The coins that are buttoned up over time a are the ones with the huge market caps. There are enough events and releases in the future to easily push this coin to a 100 million + market cap. Buy your coins cheap now or regret it later.

Author: thedreamer
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: It's always funny to see newb accounts come out of the woodwork when a pump or dump is about to happen. That's when you know what your next move should be. With the BTC rise of 6%+ over the past week, other altcoin pumps ( and dumps) NXC has actually been going up strong for the past 2 weeks. the ups and downs are for people buying and priming for a pump. Pretty obvious. Be it in 2 days or after the beta, either way it'll be here as expected.  The daily ups and downs are for the little profiting between people. Again, nothing new. IF someone is worried about the short-term price, just sell outright and find a less stressful past-time .  We could have another fun ride like what happened with PASC a few weeks ago coming. (Went 50x+ vs 3 or 4 months ago.)    And remember, NOBODY will tell you to sell a stock/crypo from the goodness of their hearts. Most of all not on this forum. People who are cheer leading a stock/crypo are the same way. Do you own serious DD, look at the charts, buys vs sells, buy and sell walls and you can figure out what might be comping up.  Heck, also I know I have been stuck bagholding an alt that crashed for months only to find it got pumped and actually made money in the long term. Unless it's a total scam of a coin (like zonecoin for example recently)you will not lose $$ on crypto unless you sell in the log-term.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I feel like a lot of people also aren't pointing out one of the best assets of Nexium, and thats the team itself. They're really buttoned up. I like that they have a solid road map, with a lot of avenues for promotion. The fact that they're making the game a free download is a really smart, and well thought out part of a plan to make the game a lot easier to market.  It's also great that the team is european, the competitive gaming front for RTS is really strong in Europe, non competitive as well. One of the best Starcraft (another RTS game) players, Stephano was French/Tunisian, so france itself has an affinity for these style of games. I think that growth for BTV seems incredibly natural in the european market.  Europe is largely responsible for the growth of esports into a world market. You look at the way professional european soccer clubs are buying up esports teams, and the success of teams like fnatic, maybe the most popular esports team in the world based out of the EU, and you can see why its really advantageous for BTV to be in france.  It's being said that by 2019, the e-sports industry will be worth over $1.2 billion and viewership will have increased to around 303 million. That's insane growth from what it was just 5 years ago....  I also think that european pro gamers might be more open to embracing a competitive game started, and based out of France.  And thats not to say there wont be a push here in the states too, I know i'll certainly be playing and trying to promote the game, along with a lot of others here, but it just ads another wrinkle that the team can tap the EU a lot easier than if this game was based out of the US, and that they're multilingual. It all helps during promotion.

I also got a lot of questions regarding the infrastructure for the merchants.  Unlike with EDS that uses counterparty along with the existing infrastructure, BtV uses ETH.  Nexium and the related assets won't be trading on decentralized exchanges such as Tokenly, BOO, or Dex.  If we all rely on a centralized exchange that would suck.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I am not familiar with all these games.  It would be interesting to see the revenue of each one of them and then see for how much they sold for those that sold.  I would bet that for some of those, sale prices relate less to revenue than to data obtained and network effect. Compared to blockchain based games, how much games such as BtV the company or EDS sell won't matter to any of us as asset holders.  How much revenue BtV is making doesn't affect us either.  Only network effect matters to drive the price of our assets up in addition to assets' specification and cross game acceptance.  This is also assuming that BtV or EDS won't close door and shut down the game.  So far Huntercoin is the only fully decentralized game that cannot be shutdown.  I hope that future games will strive towards this goal.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I'm happy to join the BTV slack, and i'll be around every now and then, but I tend to stay on BTC talk especially when i'm looking to write something longer. I have found that slack, though a great tool, can also be problematic for coins looking for new investors.  Why is that?  Here is my theory.... Every coin has a slack now, it's a great way to build a community, but I think it's tough to get brand new investors to join a slack even tough its just a click away. I think BTC talk is still the best tool for people to make an impulse investment on a coin (which there is a lot of in crypto). When I'm on polo, and I see a nice chart... I want to do some basic reading, see the specs of coin, and get coverage on any new news/hype. You can do it on slack, but i feel like i'm always scrolling through pages of conversation to get to the legitimate info. I'd also say a lot of investors in crypto are lurking, they don't even want to be known, they want quick info, and boom, they want to decide if they're trading or not. Polo pumps are so quick currently, a lot of investors are in and out, so it's important to have some good stuff here to get those impulse buys.   I'm probably going to hold almost all of my NXC for the next couple months as the beta gets ready to drop, so slack is a good option for me, but for other coins that i'm trading day to day or even hour to hour... I don't want to join every slack for every coin i'm getting in on. Like pascal. I wouldn't waste my time joining the pascal slack... but I was on the btc talk page the instant it started pumping.  Even though this site is still trashy, and its not as convenient to have a large group discussion...I still like coming here and saying my piece, because this is where the investors come first, and in crypto that first impression means a lot.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I don't think I fully understand what youre saying, but I was just trying to answer the question of what makes BTV different from the free mobil app games out there.  For now, BTV is like the free MOBAs out there mixed with with an RTS... there are no advantageous upgrades, It's essentially skins like counterstrike or overwatch, which have been extremely profitable for those games .Thats different from clash of clans and all the other In game purchase app games.   I think it's a great choice for the first version, because it will attract a lot more longterm user. If I can play a full version of a game for free, that's much more exciting than having to pay to compete like you do in clash of clans  My theory though... is that if the game is successful, you probably will see a spin off game, or a campaign mode... where the devs take advantage of the popularity and create a game with ingame purchases, and a full backstory for the game, because that could generate an enormous amount of money... and i'm sure the  dev team understands that.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: The reason why your logic make sense is because you regard Nexium equal to dollars or fiat.  But it is not.  Money can be divided into two categories: IOU (currencies) or assets (gold).   If Nexium was an IOU (which it is not) then I could take your example and rephrase by leaving the dollar out as it only adds complexity:  “if you assume the game is worth 1000 units represented by 1000 nexiums.  Now you add a mothership worth 10 units or 10 nexiums.  The value of the game is now 1010 units, but the number of total nexiums not only remains at 1000 but decrease by 5 through burn, then you end up with 995 nexiums to represent a game worth 1010 units.  Since the game value increased 1% and the IOU (nexiums) did not reflect the increase of 1%, but decreased half a percent, you end up with a deflation rate of 1.5%”.  This is how it works with national currencies except that the central banks usually create more money than the increase in GDP.  But since Nexium is not an IOU, it can only be an asset.  Being an asset it can only be part of the game, and not being a reflection of the game just as gold is part of a country's assets among many other assets and their qualities, and not a reflection of its economy.  All things considered, Nexium can be considered like any other cards of the game without its qualities.  But BtV could just as well create a card with all its qualities including for the purpose of trade. Lets say that the Satoshi cards with all its qualities was actually the asset of choice to trade all other assets (cards) of the game.  Then it could be used as a card within the game as well as money within exchanges.  it is not because you put a nice piece of art on an asset that all of sudden it cannot be used as money.  So we certainly could conclude that Nexium is a “card” without its qualities and its piece of art.  To understand the above logic, you need to not only make the difference between IOU money and asset based money, but you also need to differentiate between Value (qualitative) and price (quantitative).  In my own opinion, price never meets value and this is disputable.  But the reason I believe that, is because too many outside factors (speculation) distorts price which makes it impossible for price to reflect value.  In the example of Bitcoin, people say the value of bitcoin is volatile.  But what they mean is the price is volatile.  The actual value of bitcoin has been constant and up.  Value of bitcoin being based on degree of decentralization, network effect, and security (hash rate).  I also like to add that I agree with those posts (mostly from fudders) that Nexium is totally useless for the game as XCP could have been used on the counterparty exchanges (in this case ether on the Ethereum exchanges).  To raise money for ICO, the exchange of Bitcoins and ranks with all its goodies could have been made directly.  Or BtV could have used nexiums temporarily and then have it burned after final exchange with rank title allong with all the goodies.  Actually I would go as far as to say that adding another altcoin to a game is a distraction away from the game and hurts the price of newly created assets as most traders (especially the fudders here) only focus on the nexium price without any regard of the game asset (goodies) price or the game itself.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I think what people outside of the gaming world dont understand is that Beyond the Void is unique. They're are no Real Time Strategy (RTS) games that are free to play, and have a chance to gain a marketshare of the competitive gaming market.  It's important to understand some history surrounding competitive or professional gaming...  Originally RTS games dominated the market. Star Craft (an RTS) was incredibly popular in Korea, to the extent that it the best players became national celebrities similar to sports heros in the US, the game was also quite popular in france, and seems to of left an impression on the Dev team.  but anyway Starcraft one was released in the late 90s. It blows up, everybody adores the game. Everyone thinks RTS games are the future of competitive because of how much fun they are to watch compared to other games. There is an awesome amount of build and suspense in my opinion compared to other games...  RTS games have a problem. Theyre expensive to produce or at least for something as intricate as the starcraft gaming series. It takes a lot of time as well. Star craft 2 was released 15 years after the first star craft. That's a serious problem. It's also an expensive game to buy. Over 60 USD when it first came out.  There was a ton of hype in the gaming community for the release, but it turned out to be a bit of a letdown. Why? Because while star craft 2 was taking a decade and a half to  develop a new game arose to take its place. MOBA (multiplayer online battle arena) games were quick, simple to learn, hard to master, and free to play. DOTA and league of legends (two MOBAs) gained wild popularity because of this. All of the sudden anyone with a computer could get one of these games for free, and jump into a game where they could possibly turn professional. These games took a huge chunk out of RTS market share of competitive gaming. They basically killed off Star Craft 2 before it even started. Yes Star Craft 2 does get played on a professional level, but it's not the giant that star craft 1 was.  What does this have to do with Beyond the Void?  From what I can tell BTV has a chance to be a hybrid between a RTS and and a MOBA. It's taking some of the best aspects of an RTS game,  and its making it free, easy to play and learn. I havent really seen a whole lot of games in that market. I think the potential for a strong competitive RTS game is huge, and it looks like the BTV team has their shit together interms of making a game thats fun to play  The guy comparing it to an android game doesn't understand why this is much much better, so I will explain. The andriod games that he's talking about.. (i'm assuming) Mobile strike, Clash of Clans... These games suck on a competitive level, because they have in game purchases, basically these games are on a timer. To do anything fun you either have to wait, or pay to build your armies. The "best" players end up paying large sums of money to even have a chance to win.  Beyond the void doesnt do any of that shit. It's straight up aptitude. If youre the best player, your the best player. The pure competition, and the fact that the game is free to play is what separates BTV from all of the trash apps out there.  I hope everyone thinks about that...This is going to be a rare type of game, if the game grows large following, NXC will have a pretty massive rise. I'm thinking somewhere around .0007 on release, and if the game is good, which I think it will be... who knows how high this could go.

Author: mitchr4
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Yea i mean it all banks on this first version. I think if you can get the competitive version balanced properly, and it's fun to beat an opponent the door is wide open for possibilities with in game purchases for a campaign mode, The team seems to be on a pretty tight deadline for this first strictly competitive version, but if it's successful this game could expand in so many different ways. Story growth in particular, spin off games of a different genre. So many games get successful, and then generate huge profits outside of the original game.  Angry birds is an optimistic of an example, but the amount of revenue they've generated from what was a free game shows why BTV is so attractive for the value of NXC. They made a fortune from the game, and the spin off versions, they made a fortune in merchandising, and they made a fortune for selling the movie rights.  Here is the thing about people calling calling this a coin worthless. Their whole argument banks on the idea that this coin is just a ETH copy. That there isn't anything innovative about NXC. They don't account for the possibilities after the original release of the game. This could easily spawn into an entire franchise. If you create a successful game its incredibly valuable.  I was a little disrespectful earlier when I explained why this game wasn't just another Android app game, but lets examine one of those run of the mill android games...Clash of clans is made by supercell. They make a lot of run of the mill, basic, in-game purchase, shitty app games. They couldn't be a big company could they i mean those games can't really make money, right?  Supercell, generated $2.3 billion in revenue and profited $964 million last year. The $5.5 billion-dollar gaming company is worth more than Evernote, Eventbrite, and BuzzFeed combined  Each EMPLOYEE at Supercell is worth more than $5 million. yes, not owner, every single EMPLOYEE is worth 5 million dollars.  The people who attack this coin are missing the best part about this coin. The gaming industry is massive, and it's growing rapidly everyday. You don't need to be anything special to have a massive hit, your game just needs to be free, and decently fun to play.  Clash of clans is a trash game Boom Beach is a trash game Clan royale is a trash game  I don't even know people who play these games, but supercell is making Billions of dollars off of them. I tried clash of clans for a day, and deleted it, because it was that boring. Anyone trashing what this coin is based off the tech is completely ignorant of what the BTV team is trying to do.  When BTV releases the open beta in a few months this coin is going to enter a global market that is has been growing at an explosive rate for the past 30 years. it's not a niche market coin like almost all of the crap on polo. If the game has any kind of success this coin is in for a wild ride.

Author: chilly2k
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: You made me really have to think on this one.  I believe your assumption that Nexium is an asset of the game is incorrect.  If you assume the game is worth $1000.  and there are 1000 NXC available each would be valued at $1.  Now you add a mother ship worth 10 NXC. or $10.  The value of the Game is now $1010 and the number of Nexium goes to 995 (50% of 10 burned).  So now a NXC would be valued at $1.015   ($1010/995NXC).      You could also counter and say once the mother ship is sold it is no longer an asset of the game.  I could believe that too.  In that case the game would still be worth $1000 but now there are only 995 NXC so each would be worth 1.005.  Still a gain but not as great.  Assuming the base value remains constant, if you decrease the basis of value (NXC), the value of the remaining basis should increase.      Think Stock by-backs.  If a company is worth $1000 and has 1000 shares of stock, each share is worth $1.  But if the company buys back 500 shares, there are only 500 remaining so now those 500 shares are worth $2.            Maybe I'm missing something but it seems deflationary to me.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: To understand the value of Nexium you have to understand the economy of the game it is used in and disregard speculation for the purpose of simplicity. Nexium is actually part of the game just like any other game assets except that it is used as money. Let's assume that the game is worth 100 units (game and its assets).  If the game devs are adding 1 asset (like a mothership), then it is increasing the value of the game lets say by 1 unit.  Then the game is worth 101 units.  However if you are burning another asset (Nexium) worth equal to what is added in value, then the game is back to worth 100 units. The question now remains whether burning only 50% of nexiums' revenue from sales of new assets is worth the added value, is less than the added value (inflation), or is more than the added value (deflation). I believe that new assets sold in the early stage of the game will add more value to the game than assets sold in the later stage.  However the burn rate will remain the same resulting in inflation in long term.  This is why I don't believe the Nexium or Bitcrystal economy is sustainable over the long run unless the game devs acting like the Fed decided to intervene and adjust the burn rate at will. Please note that the network effect (popularity) increases the value of the game.  This also will cause nexiums' price to increase in the early stage. One other thing that might increase the value of the game is whether the issued assets become collectibles.  I am not certain that beyond the Void will have this benefits, but cards like Force of Will, Spells of Genesis or Age of Chains will. The advantages of those cards is that they are on the Bitcoin blockchain.

Author: len01
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: yes, NXC will do a signature campaign, sosial media campaign and another bounty  Quote from: Dcrstats on January 26, 2017, 10:19:56 AM   And here it comes: we have a great news again!  Manon (marketing / community manager of the Beyond the Void) is working to start the marketing campaign which will be including:  - Bounties for Signatures Campaign (bitcointalk) - Bounties for Social Networks campaign - Bounties for blog posts about the Beyond the Void game - The list of Requests for Proposals (jobs for the community)  All payments will be made in NXC using the marketing budget.  🚀🚀🚀 Fasten your seat belt, we're ready to take off! 🚀🚀🚀  One more time devs showed to us that Beyond the Void is here to stay. I really proud that devs trust us, their community, and allow us to participate in the future of the game already in this early stage! More interesting stuff is coming soon!

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Marketing campaign including:  - signature campaign on Bitcointalk: 150 000 NxC - social media campaign: 150 000 NxC - blog post bounties: 200 000 NxC  Is starting on the 21st of February, one day before the beta for backer release. More info will be coming at the beginning of February about how to register.

Author: souljah1h
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: They didn't dump. You don't believe anymore?  Quote from: Beyond the Void on January 24, 2017, 02:28:35 PM Quote from: Beyond the Void on January 20, 2017, 08:57:57 PM Alright guys, I am back here.  The reason why we are not on Slack/Bitcointalk 24/7 is very simple: we are 4 in the team, and only 3 people full time. We have work to do and a game to develop so we can't spend that much time on forums. We also have families and lives outside the project.  We proved many times in the past that we were answering questions, and that we made ourselves available to discuss things with the community.  Asking a question about why we move funds to Poloniex should be very simple and quick. Making a post screaming scam is an obvious way to manipulate the price.  Now, answering the questions:  If you go on the Rich list: http://nexiumstats.com/, you'll see that the Initial address, the one that created the tokens, still hold 8,715,621.127 NxC. That's because some members of our team didn't even take the time to distribute their share of Nexiums like we announced we would. So for the most part, the "hidden" 15 million are still on the initial address. That should show everybody in which "hurry" we are to sell coins    240 days ago was the end of our presale... So no worries there, everything looks normal.  Now the last transaction: Rémi, our blockchain developer on the project, wanted to send some of his OWN Nexiums to Poloniex but didn't distribute his Nexiums from the Initial address yet. So actually he took them directly from the initial address... That was maybe not the best thing to do on his part, but it is still his Nexiums, and the amount was not big either. He is entitled to do what he seems fit with his NxC. This Nexium repartition was announced from the beginning, before the presale, and before the ICO. It is stated very clearly on our website.  We, as team members of Beyond the Void, understand that dumping a lot of tokens on Poloniex or any other exchange would put down the price and kill the project. This is NOT what we want, therefore we are NOT dumping Nexiums.  One other thing: when holding a big amount of tokens, it is very recommended to separate the amount on several addresses, for obvious security reasons... We are not doing that to hide anything. Everyone can see the blockchain, and it is even easier now with the richlist.  Again, I would like to remind everybody that we have videos showing the game on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD1IdjsnzXFdOarY20gMPQQ  We have a very busy schedule in the next few months, and I invite you all to check on us at these up coming events:  January 27th:               Coin Interview, a live interview on YouTube  February 17th-18th:     EDCON in Paris, France  March 3rd-4th:              Lyon E-Sport #10 in Lyon, France  April 6th:                       Blockshow Europe in Munich, Germany  April 8th :                      CoinFest UK in Manchester, United Kingdom  On the 27th of January, the interview with Coin Interview will include a LIVE DEMO of Beyond the Void. If anyone still had any doubts about the product existence after the live demo with Shaban Shaame from Spells of Genesis last October, they should not have any after the 27th of January. Reading your posts and these trustscores below, I have come to the conclusion you are a scammer / troll.    Welcome to my ignore now.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: What makes you think that the dump trolls are BCY investors?  EDS and BtV are closely related and how the coins function within the games are similar.  I don't believe that either EDS or BtV got the economy right, but it is a nice way to test it.  I believe that in the LONG RUN the value (price) of the coin is not sustainable.  Nexium will certainly reach a record high, but after that I believe that the coin's value depends on the BtV team, just as the price of BCY depends on the EDS team.  When you only burn half the price of a coin it equals to the Fed creating inflation.  In other words, EDS and BtV are actors similar to the fed.  The reason why BCY  price went down is because they had record card sales.  When BCY price goes down, you have the option to either sell BCY at a loss or buy cards that are pegged to BCY.  The incentive in this case would be to buy the cards which in turn create more inflation and which result into a downward price spiral.  Only when EDS stopped converting their earned BCY into BTC did the price go up as of late. I hope that in the future a game will come out with a different economy for the coin, or even better, without any new coin.  It would be interesting to see through facts which coins fare better. Also interesting to note is that EDS recently launched a new coin called Musecoin which is pegged to the Swiss Frank.  It would be interesting to see if it keeps its price when it hits the exchanges.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Alright guys, I am back here.  The reason why we are not on Slack/Bitcointalk 24/7 is very simple: we are 4 in the team, and only 3 people full time. We have work to do and a game to develop so we can't spend that much time on forums. We also have families and lives outside the project.  We proved many times in the past that we were answering questions, and that we made ourselves available to discuss things with the community.  Asking a question about why we move funds to Poloniex should be very simple and quick. Making a post screaming scam is an obvious way to manipulate the price.  Now, answering the questions:  If you go on the Rich list: http://nexiumstats.com/, you'll see that the Initial address, the one that created the tokens, still hold 8,715,621.127 NxC. That's because some members of our team didn't even take the time to distribute their share of Nexiums like we announced we would. So for the most part, the "hidden" 15 million are still on the initial address. That should show everybody in which "hurry" we are to sell coins    240 days ago was the end of our presale... So no worries there, everything looks normal.  Now the last transaction: Rémi, our blockchain developer on the project, wanted to send some of his OWN Nexiums to Poloniex but didn't distribute his Nexiums from the Initial address yet. So actually he took them directly from the initial address... That was maybe not the best thing to do on his part, but it is still his Nexiums, and the amount was not big either. He is entitled to do what he seems fit with his NxC. This Nexium repartition was announced from the beginning, before the presale, and before the ICO. It is stated very clearly on our website.  We, as team members of Beyond the Void, understand that dumping a lot of tokens on Poloniex or any other exchange would put down the price and kill the project. This is NOT what we want, therefore we are NOT dumping Nexiums.  One other thing: when holding a big amount of tokens, it is very recommended to separate the amount on several addresses, for obvious security reasons... We are not doing that to hide anything. Everyone can see the blockchain, and it is even easier now with the richlist.  Again, I would like to remind everybody that we have videos showing the game on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD1IdjsnzXFdOarY20gMPQQ  We have a very busy schedule in the next few months, and I invite you all to check on us at these up coming events:  January 27th:               Coin Interview, a live interview on YouTube  February 17th-18th:     EDCON in Paris, France  March 3rd-4th:              Lyon E-Sport #10 in Lyon, France  April 6th:                       Blockshow Europe in Munich, Germany  April 8th :                      CoinFest UK in Manchester, United Kingdom  On the 27th of January, the interview with Coin Interview will include a LIVE DEMO of Beyond the Void. If anyone still had any doubts about the product existence after the live demo with Shaban Shaame from Spells of Genesis last October, they should not have any after the 27th of January.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Devs from Beyond the Void are not from Spells of Genesis. Two different projects with different people.  We chose to develop using the Ethereum blockchain for the smart contracts, for the transaction speed, and also because we believe in this technology.  Why did we choose to create Nexiums instead of using Ethers: thanks to Nexiums we could have an ICO, and get the funds to develop the project. That's the start of everything. One other reason is that we wanted to have a token separated from the Ether thus create a market with the Nexium value depending on the project's quality and not Ether or Bitcoin directly.  "What's the point of digital assets if I can only use them in one game?" : our plan is to develop partnerships with other games, or even other blockchain projects, related or not to gaming (if it fits). This way, Beyond the Void assets can be used not only in our game. Also, we could give value & existence to other assets (like Spells of Genesis assets, it's already the case for Crystalibur) in our game. That's what we call cross-gaming. It's the possibility to create an entire ecosystem using the same assets, not only ours, but from other games & apps as well.  These questions are the heart of Beyond the Void project, and we like to talk about it with the community. If you have questions or suggestions, we would like to have you on Slack.  http://beyond-the-void.signup.team/  Edit: about your post on replays, I think this specific question should be asked to Rémi directly. He is the blockchain dev, but also the game designer and he certainly has things to say about this.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I think the point that HasHe is making is that we don't need another currency besides bitcoin (or maybe ethereum).  You could have used Nexium the same way as you used Protonexium to raise funds through an ICO.  Nexium could be redeemed for ranking and then burned (the same way Protonexium was burned).  The disadvantage of using Nexium for game asset sales is that you will have to exchange it for bitcoins and/or fiat in a thin market.  Why not just get bitcoins instead?  I believe that this is also why SOG sold their most valuable assets in bitcoins rather than bitcrystals on black Friday such as the Satoshicard.  Another disadvantage is that the more assets get sold and the more nexium will hit the market which will drive the price down.  This goes against your interest because your revenue in fiat term will diminish as you sell more assets due to nexium price decrease.  On the other hand, if asset sales decrease, then price of nexium goes up, which then will lead people to sell their nexiums rather than use those nexiums to buy more assets from you, which in turn will again decrease your revenue.  I can take my case an as example in SOG.  I bought loads of BCY when the price was cheap a few weeks ago for the purpose of buying cards.  However the price has increased so much now that I am instead thinking selling my BCYs rather than buy more cards.  In conclusion, adding another currency into the market adds unnecessary complexity.  The only thing of value in the game should be game assets not including another shitcoin.  This attracts speculators and day traders who are more interested in making quick money out of a pump and dump at the expense of collectible game assets.

Today the avatar costs 10$ and bitcoin 1000$. Tomorrow chinese exchanges have an inspection and the same avatar costs 7$ and bitcoin 700$. Next, China has a New Year and avatar costs 11$ and bitcoin 1100$. Then, bitfinex hacked again and avatar costs 4$ and bitcoin 400$ ...  Your "solution" solves absolutely nothing.
