Author: LiskQH
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Blog post about the first Milestone  Rescheduling our First Milestone “A delayed game is eventually good. A bad game is bad forever.” ~ Nintendo legend Shigeru Miyamoto  Hi, this is Remi. A little over a week ago, we brought Johan Dufour on board to be our front-end advisor. His first project is to help us bring out the second major iteration of our shop. I built the first iteration in October, but it just wasn’t good enough! (My strengths are in blockchain smart contracts, not e-commerce front-ends). Johan and I have paired up as a team, and are applying our combined talents to creating a much nicer version of the store. Therefore, we are rescheduling our first milestone from February 8th to February 22nd.  So to summarize, here’s our updated development/release schedule:  ● We’ll distribute the backer’s assets and provide a check balance tool on February 1st ● We will release the new version of the store on 22nd of February  Please keep in mind that we’re holding a live demo with CoinInterview on January 27th where we’ll demo what we’ve developed so far and provide an update on the project. Then, on February 1st, we will distribute the assets along with a tool for you to be able to check your balances. Then, we will take a few more weeks to release the shop. We also plan to present the finished shop at the EDCON on February 17/18 of February in Paris. Although these types of delays are common in software development, we understand if some of you feel a disappointed or frustrated by the delay. We care about your thoughts, so we are bringing you news of this delay sooner rather than later. We hope you accept our apologies. Please know that we will continue working hard to make things right. Sincerely, Remi, Johan, and the other team members.  PS: Keep in mind that we are still going to the following events, which will include live presentations of the game and the store:  ● January 27th:   Coin Interview, a live interview & game demo on YouTube  ● February 17th-18th:   EDCON in Paris, France  ● March 3rd-4th:   Lyon E-Sport #10 in Lyon, France  ● April 6th:   Blockshow Europe in Munich, Germany  ● April 8th :   CoinFest UK in Manchester, United Kingdom

Body: okok, im getting a better picture and the recent cointerview helped answer some questions, i'll take back what I said but still have some other questions.  hmm, they said how players cant earn Nexium, why not create a ranking system where it costs lets say - .05 cents to play or a monthly entry fee of $5(x amount of Nex) and monthly highest rankers will be rewarded for their play. Having a pro gaming background, this is something that would have incentivized me hardcore to play, practice and get better. Living as a progamer couple years back, I loved it, only problem was it was increasingly difficult to earn a living from it. I streamed with viewers topping at 5k and earned a bunch from coaching but it would be much more rewarding, I believe, to actually earn money for talented players.  Could this be put into consideration? Possibly set a seperate ranking systems so players have a choice whether to pay and compete.  Another thing I would like to put out there are replays.  Replays are downloaded thousands of times, the good ones can reach millions. Point being, my replays were always demanded so people could study them to become better players. It would be mindblowing if players could sell their replays for whatever price they deem worthy. This would also have helped me further my progaming scene.  Etherplay.io records all of their games on the blockchain, I mentioned this idea to them and they said its something that could be added... Could this also be something you would add in the future? After all, you guys are creating a competitive RTS MOBA and if  Beyond The Void picks up steam, the same thing will happen thats happening now in E-sports, everyone wants to be a pro-gamer, they will study replays to the core. Thats what I did, I would have been fine with paying a minimal fee to download replays knowing im also supporting my favorite gamers!

Body: Walled gardens are a perfectly reasonable place to use your own token, since the garden is the value you control. Body: Well man I don't wanna discuss with you anymore. It's clear that you don't know how these markets works.  "Overvalued", "inflated", "pumped", it's all the same. Next time, think a bit before investing in a project man.   You need all the information & all the cards in the table to decide if a project is trustworthly or not. Well that's not going to happen, if you want some extra info you will have to look for it.  This is the essence of VC investing, to trust or not to trust. Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hello !  We announced the shop for the 25th of January, but to be honest the schedule is a little bit off, by a couple of weeks. Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Nobody in the team is a front end developer, and we had to find someone to help us with the shop's interface. We did find someone, Johan (you can see his picture in our last newsletter) but all of this took some unexpected time. The shop is still in well-advanced development, but all the features won't be released at once as a result.  The beta isn't late though.

Author: VultureFund
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I already told you so in another message. When you release dev wallets public, and those have a big % of shares, any minor movement will be used by the whales to dump hard the price.  I tell you what I think, they saw inflated prices at the start and decided to sell a small part, like 2-3M. And it's a clever decision, because NXC in the launch at 5-7K was overvalued. Now they don't wanna show the wallets because those 2-3M would be missing, and FUD would go to the next level. "Look at those, dumping dev coins to the investors!!!"  Lots of well-known and reputable projects have been dumping coins secretly for development. And now you say: Yeah, but that was the first day! And I say: yeah, but the price was clearly manipulated high and the volume was big. The moment to sell some was then. Now don't get me wrong, I'm not defending a full dump of 15M. That would be a disastrous behaviour. But I defend a 2-3M dump, because funds are for that, and the price was too high.   I was following the price action and the orderbooks all the first day man. It was a clear whale manipulation to make noobs buy "the new polo thing". Everything was bullish until they put a 150 BTC sell wall and crashed the price. The following days, they kept dumping, dried the buy orderbooks and so on. In addition, BTC was rallying hard in that time so it was more easy to supress the price.  That is the classical price supression dumpage after Polo add man. Important projects that now are rocking hard followed the same pattern. Factom, XEM, AMP, ETH, ... were all dumped to hell during weeks and months before making the big rallies. There's nothing strange or suspitious in NXC behaviour that we haven't seen other times.   To finish. I agree with you, there should be a richlist and full list of transactions. But all this complains, you should ask them personally, instead of spreading the FUD here. You're shoting yourself in the feet. Whales are very aware of the emotions that bitcointalk topic shows. If they see FUD here, they will supress the price even more and make scared little investors sell at a big lose.

Author: Xtrata
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: That is a really poor argument to justify holding 15M coins hidden, that whales could dump the price if they see any movement in these wallets. What is the difference from that from what happened when it went on the exchange? Nothing. It works just as good on the other way around to say that they cannot see the wallets so they might just dump anytime.  You cannot simply say that something is "overvalued" there is a supply and demand, the price it gets is the correct one based on that. Which well-known projects are you talking about that dumped secretly?  I know very well how the markets works but that doesn't change what I've stated before, if they dumped 2-3M or 15M it doesn't matter. It is the thing that they might have done it and are hiding from telling the truth and keep using the lame excuse "privacy" when you asked for people's money.  The other coins/tokens you bring up there at least had full transaction list/richlist of all funds, nothing hidden so you could track it and do your own judgement if investing was a good thing or not.  I should not need to go to them personally to ask them for a richlist/transacations or their wallets, this is something they should had provided from day 1 when it went on the exchange or even before that.  Just a reminder to you, this is not FUD, it is a fact that they are hiding 15M coins or less if they sold it and refuse to show it publicly. You seem to be more interested in the price rather then the actual game it is there we are go apart of how we think about this situation.

Author: VultureFund
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Yo-yo, calm down trolls & FUDers.  Yeah Xtrata, you have a valid point, those 15M should be a public knowing because there was an ICO involved. But think about it:  Possibility 1: They sold some of their coins once they were released on exchange at overvalued prices.  Possibility 2: They haven't sold anything and don't wanna publish teir adresses because they don't want people know when they sell.   - Anyway, does it fucking matter at all to be generating all this FUD?  If they have sold and only have 5M now, what happens? Nothing, they have more $$ in their pockets and whales and investors have more NXC in them. I don't thing it's a good move to sell NXC now, because in some months they will be worth more and the team already had $$, but if they want they can do it.  As long as they release the game and keep improving it when it's released, who the fuck cares where are the DEV personal coins? Vitalik sold their official ETH share at the higest point when Ethereum was rocking. Ovbiously nobody complaint because everyone was having nice profits in ETH. Here everyone complains simply because they are losing money temporary and are not able to hold their assets for months. They want profit, and they want it NOW. Go to the fucking casino then, you'll have instant profits... & instant losses.   I repeat, if they continue the development in a hard way, nothing to worry about. If they don't deliver the product, don't worry, I'll be the first one to complain and ask for responsabilities, but I don't thing that this will be necessary.

Body: Which anonymous devs started an ICO and collected as much as NXC devs did.  I do believe transparency is a must, people invested into this project would like to see exactly what happens with their funds.  I work at a big assets management company, managing over 90 Billion in assets. We release annual reports that include details of what we invested in and P/L from every investment. Full Transparency...how do you know funds aren't being spent on personal things or if it's all gone?  Sorry but "just trust the devs" is idiotic and ignorant, if you're going to trust every dev here then you're going to be homeless and broke really soon. If the devs don't have anything to hide, why not post full details of the addresses they hold all coins, expense reports...etc  I also would jump really quick if they sold their shares in NXC that just shows me they don't believe in the project. Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Nexium is based on a blockchain that is transparent.  If it were based on zcash or monero I would understand your concerns.  I have been checking out the nexium blockchain in the last 2 days and all my questions are being answered by the team.  I think it is possible to have transparency while at the same time have privacy.  I watch the addresses of the top ICO investors, but I don't need their names. So far I found out that what caused the Nexium price to decrease when it reached Poloniex on 12/20 was caused by three whales (of which two have connections) having more than 1/3 of today's total balance on Poloniex. I can imagine that on 12/20 they probably had closer to 90%.  But I would not know this because I cannot see the complete history on Etherscan (only shows 200 transactions).  If anyone can help me to find a way to get those hidden transactions I could find out more. I agree for transparency, but especially regarding bigger issues.  Half of our money is being taken away by criminals through what they call taxes, and we don't even know what they do with it.  Reasonable guess would be that they squander it to promote war and regime change all over the world.  So being upset at a small team because of some petty cash we invested is not my priority.  Besides, they have a reputation to maintain especially since they are somewhat connected to Everdreamsoft.

Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Look man, first thing, these devs are not anonymous by any way. You can go to Lyon-France and visit them if you want.  Second thing, you are angry because you made a bad decision by buying at 6K-7K when there was any rational reason to do so. You should investigate more before trading because this world has nothing to be with blue chips of S&P 500.  Third thing. I explain you, because seems that you don't know how this works: Devs hold a big % of shares in this project. In these wild west markets, ANY minor thing will be maximized. Any minor development will push the price high, and any minor FUD signal will push the price down. Devs have 15M of PERSONAL coins (yeah, it was in the ICO, that is their share. If you don't like it you shouldn't have bought). Now imagine that in 6 months, Devs decide to sell 1M, just 1M. If this information goes public, believe me, there would be a MAJOR unreasonable dump. How I said, this markets are full of whales and they will take advantage of any situation. The FUD appears quickly, and devs dumping coins generates tons of FUD and inestability in prices.  So yeah, I prefer that they keep those wallets private. They are developing the product, and I understand that they should have a major share of it, as any other business. If you don't like this fact, I don't know why did you bought NXC, or ever worse, why the fuck did you bough it at 6K-7K.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: If some members of the team want to give their address, that's their business but Beyond the Void won't give away personal addresses. You can always find the richest addresses on the blockchain, but we don't have the tool to provide an accurate richlist.  About the 15 million for promotion:  - we spent already 1 million for the ICO promotion (you can see lots of blog, forum posts, articles published in various famous media from this period) - You'll notice that another million is missing: it is the fuel for the current promotion. Nexiums were sent to Poloniex, but we DIDN'T dump them. That's for us to say and for you to believe.  I am planning several things for the next months:  - We have a busy event schedule, with lots of blockchain conferences: blockshow europe, coinfest etc and also indie game festivals. I'll update the timeline as soon as I have full confirmation from all parties. - We are planning to release articles and blog posts in various media.  Company addresses:  0x75144bab217bf7c2c34d3238fbc54a84236ffbed 0x13703196b22e39d40d03d552dc35c6d4cbacc226 0x66cb9c47b90d2dc82e7e8d8d4f21fe670bc2c5c9 0x64640ddbb4b620e0307be0cdd9c866de3ede4e97 0x01f9f1c2f51b82438be76bcfffcd1951ea3deab9

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: We are a company, selling products. Our product now is the game Beyond the Void, and selling game assets is part of our economy. We chose to burn half of the NxC to increase the token scarcity. The ETH/BCY we got from the ICO are meant to be spent on the game's develop only. Once all of that is spent, we need an income to continue the adventure.  About the timeline: for now, we only released the timeline until the game's release (and I have news so I'll update it soon). But the game has to continue improving even after the release. We will update it, create new assets, new event cards, develop the gameplay. And of course we have to maintain the servers, correct bugs etc.  Same goes for the promotion: 15 million NxC seem to be a lot, but not when you think that it's for three of four years. Also, most of those will be spent to promote the game, and the game is not out yet (first beta is coming soon though).  About the rich list: we don't have a tool allowing to see the richest address. We could check from time to time, but it would always be the richest addresses at that time. Everything is on the blockchain anyway of course, but that's there we are at now.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: In people minds, we hold 50% of the token. This is not right: there is not one address with 50% of NxC total supply on it.  Here is the repartition of the first 15 Million NxC between the 4 teammates:  Maxence 6 Million Eric 4 Million Rémi 4 Million Manon 1 Million  We are still separated entities, so nobody holds more than 6 Million. Also, there are backers that hold more than us (more than 6 Million). So Maxence, who is the original creator in this project, actually holds less than our biggest backer. We actually worked a lot to bring this project to life, including lots of months where we weren't paid and we chose to be rewarded for that. This is a matter of choice of course so there is no point in discussing it now on bitcointalk.  The next 15 Million Nexiums are meant to be spent on promotion (we already spent some on those, and I'll publish soon a marketing strategy & budget). We promoted the ICO, we are now published on Forbes, listed on Poloniex and so on.  We are not interested in dumping Nexiums on the market. And the value of the Nexium is tied to the success of the game so we are focusing on releasing a good game and on time.

Author: Xtrata
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: That doesn't change the fact that the founders almost have access to 50% together, just because you pile up names with an amount it doesn't make it look any better.  Backers BOUGHT those tokens/coins from you, those who bought during the ICO has nothing to do with this, dont really know why you would take that up.  Why shouldn't we discuss this on bitcointalk, isn't that why you have a thread so people actually can talk? I think it is fair for everyone to see discussions here just as much as the people on Slack.  On your own site it clearly states the following:      Allocation of Nexiums:         15% for the founders.         15% for promoting the game.         70% for crowdfunding and other backers. "We created 100 000 000 Nexiums using a smart contract (the amount is fixed)."  This was what everyone bought into, knowing you would have 15% for the founders and 15% to promote the game. But now when you burned 30+ million and still keep the same amount of coins for founders/promotion it is not 30% in total there anymore, it is closer to 50%.  I hope you informed everyone that you would do this before they bought the into the ICO because that is very shady way of doing business.  I find it weird that you justify the amount of coins you kept because you didn't get paid the first months. If you are not going to sell it, why do you need it? Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: There really isn't anything to adjust because Owner's share, Marketing share are fixed amounts while ICO share is a mix of Fixed and variable amounts.  The table on BtV website should have shown the details as they are important: 15% Marketing, 15% founder's share, 7% minimum ICO  (based on 110,000 Euro minimum funding requirement), and 63% burn or additional funding TBD in the future.  So the only unk nown was how much would be burned and how much additional funds would be raised.  The rest is pretty much set and cannot be changed.  The way it should have been read at that time is that 40.55% go to founders, 40.55% go to marketing, and 18.90% go to ICO investors.  After ICO completion, the final shares changed to 22.55%, for owner, 22.55% to marketing, 10.52% to minimum ICO requirement with a balance to additional funding of 44.38%.  I agree however that the original 40.55% to 4 founders (I can only see 3 on the website) is a lot, but that might be the reason why only half of the available ICO coins were sold.  Had there been a better balance between those percentages, I believe BtV would have been able to collect more funds.  Now we are at least aware than 22.55% of Nexiums are owned by 4 big whales.  I mean it could have been worse.  But I am sure that this might be a cause of concern for long term investors as we don't know when or how much anyone would dump.  However I doubt this will occur before the game launches and any such dump will be visible on the blockchain.  In regards to the marketing funds (22.55% as well), it all depends what time frame is used in their budget.  If it will be used within a year, then that will cause a major downward pressure on Nexium, but if those funds will be used during the course of 10 years, then there is no need for concern.  Also coinmarketcap doesn't show these funds on the market yet.  It would be great if BtV communicated to us the details of their marketing budget sometimes when it has been decided.  As a last note, I think that owner's share, or at least part of it, should have been included as a percentage of total ICO funds collected.  Also take note that the above percentages aren't accurate as I estimated 7 million Nexiums for 110,000 Euros.

Author: bitabit
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Your above described correction makes sense based on the fact that caloydgreat used USD to compute the price, which assumes that he was using USD as a unit of account.  However, one can also decide to use BTC as a unit of account and compute market rate of Ether or BCY straight into Bitcoins completely ignoring what the price of any of those coins were in USD, which makes things much easier to understand for some.  Price of BTC/BCY was 0.000255 and BTC/ETH was 0.015.  This result in a Protonexium (1 Proto was 0.0714 BCY) to be priced at 0.00001600 BTC and in an ETH based Nexium (700 NXC to 1 ETH) to be priced at 0.00002140 BTC.  This resulted in a price difference of 33% between a BCY purchased Protonexium and an ETH purchased Nexium.  Please note that the Protonexium price was increased to 0.0833 after they replenished the swapbot.  The question is why were more people buying Nexiums through ETH rather than the cheaper alternative.  I believe that the obvious answer is laziness or assumption.  People just assumed that Beyond the Void had priced them equally, especially that there was no announcement that one would be cheaper than the other one, something that Maidsafe announced during their ICO when buying with Mastercoin (OMNI) was way cheaper than with Bitcoin.  Now considering that today's price of Nexium is about 0.00001265, people are whining that the price is below ICO price.  I actually disagree.  ICO price should not only relate to the coin, but too all the benefits that came with it.  So 1.6 Bitcoin gave you 100k of protonexiums which in turn were converted into nexiums and a rank.  Since we got only two items (nexiums and rank), we only need to know the price of one item to guess what the price of the other item is.  The market is telling us that ICO investors were ready to sell their nexiums after obtaining their rank at 1,265 satoshis.  It would be reasonable to assume, based on that, that the market price of the rank is then 335 satoshis (1600 - 1265).  Of course, this logic won't work once we get a secondary market (people who bought nexium on poloniex instead of original ICO investors).  So a Moon Administrator is priced at 0.335 BTC, a Planetary Regent is 1.34 BTC, a Star Baron is 2.1775 BTC, a Constellation king is 3.35 BTC and a Galactic Emperor is 5.695 BTC.

Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: You can buy Nexiums on Openledger, if somebody is selling. But the crowdfunding isn't finished yet, so there is a small fee if you want to trade early. Why we didn't do the crowdsale on a trading platform: we coded a smart contract that refunds automatically people if the crowdfunding goal is not reach, and we couldn't do this on a trading platform. Also, the contract is automatically calculating your bonus according to your backer rank. https://beyond-the-void.net/index.php/backer-ranks/

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi there! The ETH price is very low currently, so it is still very interesting to participate in the ICO. Actually, even with the increased Nexium price, I just did the maths and the Nexium price actually increased only not even 1,6% since the beginning of the crowdfunding.  About the ICO itself: people trust seems to come, go, come again... We are doing our best to ensure that the project as a whole is respecting milestones and deadlines. Beyond the Void is taking us 100% of our work time and minds.

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi! We don't know yet how much time the protoNexium/Nexium swap will be available, but we will do our best to ensure everybody swapped theirs before ending it. About your other question: once you backed Beyond the Void, you should receive your Nexiums immediately (or at the very least after a couple of hours, but that's very rare). Once the ICO is finished, no new backer will be able to send ETH.  We have a blog post about that: http://beyondthevoidgame.tumblr.com

Author: Febo
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I made a post https://www.reddit.com/r/BeyondTheVoidGame/comments/5acrjo/do_not_repeat_same_mistake_sog_did/ on reddit and also posted here. Is worth of read and think about it.  As i see, BeyondTheVoid crowdfunding is almost identical as was in Spells of Genesis. Maybe right now there is way more interest for such project and you will gather way more founds. But in case you dont, please dont repeat same mistake as SoG made and not burn proportional part of 30% reserved fro development and promotion.  You minimum goal is 110.000 euros what you get once you sell about 8,000.000 Nexium. Lets say. That is it. That is how much you sell after crowdfunding finish. So 62,000.000 Nexium gets burned. And there is 8,000.000 Nexium in hands of backers who founded making of the game. 15,000.000 Nexium is on wallet ment for promotion. 15,000.000 Nexium is on wallet reserved for future development. So out of 38,000.000 Nexium, the game or the development team holds 30,000.000 Nexium or almost 80%. This will latter on discourage many to even look at the coin. Since they will be afraid that at any point developers dump coins.  Solution to this is to burn same % of Nexium in development and promotion vallet. Same % as will be burnt of unsold Nexium in crowdfunding. So if you sell 35 million Nexium in crowdfunding and burn other half you also burn 7.5 million from development and 7.5 million from promotion. And that way you  keep 70/30 ratio.

Author: freequant
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: OP, given the limited leg room you have for income within the free-to-play model, consider selling planets. Let me explain. In sports games, you have the concept of "home" which refers to the siuation where a team is playing in their usual surrounding with their fans in majority with the other team being a guest, which is referred to as "away". While this is mostly psychological, the idea that one team is playing on their turf while the other team is visiting creates an asymmetry which changes the game balance, with the "home" team having maximum fan support but also maximum pressure not to lose the game on their own turf.  This can translate in a space strategy game by using planets. You could have a "deep encounter" mode where armies confront in deep space. And an "invasion" mode where one team invades the other team, with maybe a small asymmetry in the formations as one team needs to defend their planet on top of making sure they aren't destroyed. This could be compensated by some tactical advantage TBD.  The point is that, from the moment where you allow player to have a "home", that is to say a planet they own, you create the opportunity for players to show off proudly their planet / star / star system Planets could be run-of-the-mill average planets for non-paying players. But they could also be unique, one-of-a-kind planets that will surely make an impression, or even massive star systems made of multiple planets and, why not, a twin star or any other oddity. This would sell very well because the whole theme of the game is for an opponent to invade your turf and your turf is all around the place "in your face". That's the absolute best opportunity to make sure your turf is an interesting experience for your opponent, and could very well give you a psychological advantage, which remains entirely compatible with the free-to-play model. Just look at how easily "games" like secondlife have been selling real estate. Planets are likely to be perceived and valued as real estate by players. You can even create continuous interest by selling limited edition planets and star systems and/or creating tournaments with an awesome unique star system at stake.

Author: ccedk_pr
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: E-sports Game Beyond The Void to Launch World’s First MOBA Gaming ICO   Beyond the Void has joined OpenLedger and announced the launch of their ICO crowdfund starting on Tuesday, November 1 in a Forbes article. With this ICO Beyond the Void will officially compete for the world’s $20 billion MOBA market. Key things to know:  Beyond The Void is launching world’s first MOBA game ICO crowdfund on November 1, 2016. Beyond The Void is pegging nearly all in-game items to Ethereum blockchain tokens, meaning players will own and operate the game economy as they wish. Beyond The Void is launching an ICO in partnership with the crowdfunding group OpenLedger with their Nexium token. Nexium are designed to be burned upon use, so they will get increasingly scarce over time.  Beyond The Void, a new RTS-MOBA game, is about to storm the gaming industry backed by an initial coin offering (ICO) and ethereum blockchain tokens. This free-to-play game wants to be the first competitive real-time strategy (RTS) multiplayer online battle arena game (MOBA) to combine a blockchain based ICO with a blockchain token economy.  Read more: http://bitcoinprbuzz.com/e-sports-game-beyond-void-launch-worlds-first-moba-gaming-ico/    The Nexium price for the ICO    The original Nexium price on the crowdfunding opening will be 700 Nexiums/Ether. However, this price will increase every time we reach 5 million Nexium sold, as stated in the chart. See more right here: http://beyond-the-void.net/index.php/nexium-price/       Don't miss! This is (slightly) edited version of our last live on Twitch:Beyond the Void's first live with Shaban Shaame from Spell of genesis        More Updates & News about "Beyond the Void" in socials and web-site: Twitter Facebook Beyond the Void   Also check Beyond The Void official Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/BeyondTheVoidGame/ - join and feel free to share your thoughts on game and ICO

Author: explorer17
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: @Beyond the Void  IMHO if you want to succeed with your ICO you must change the blockchain. Instead of ETH I think is much better to use Counterparty. Even if you are a supporter of ETH, for the moment I consider  Counterparty and BTC blockchain a better option, and I'll offer you a few reasons for this sentence:  1. ETH blockchain is under attack right now, and it's shows a lot of vulnerabilities last time. We'll see a new hard-fork (maybe others) and your project will be affected by their technical issues;  2. Last ICO's on ETH blockchain were dumped hard, so investors lost enough money (SNGLS, REP, etc.);  3. Counterparty already support "Spells of genesis" (your partner in this project), a successful project until now, so you can learn a lot from their experience;  4. With Counterparty you can use Indiesquare wallet and Book of Orbs, also tokenly, for safe sales of your assets or to exchange them;  5. With Counterparty you already have a lot of people which experienced this kind of project with Spells of genesis, so they can understand easy and can invest in your game also;  6. In Counterparty (Book of orbs) you already have a market for "in games digital assets" for Spells of genesis and Force of will, so players can exchange or sell your assets more easy, or you can make partnership with other games to use some legendary assets in more games;    Another objection is regarding your partner ranks. I think is not a correct correlation between investment and bonuses ; ex. Moon Administrator 100.000 investment/ 8% extra bonus and Galactic Emperor 17x (1.700.000 investment) and only 2x (16%) extra bonus. The rapport 1:17 is too much in partner ranks, a normal rapport for 5 ranks could be 1:5 - you can start with 200.000/400/600/800/1.000.000.  Good luck!

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Thank you very much for your analysis.  1. ETH blockchain is under attack right now, and it's shows a lot of vulnerabilities last time. We'll see a new hard-fork (maybe others) and your project will be affected by their technical issues;  Hopefully the fork will solve this issue.  2. Last ICO's on ETH blockchain were dumped hard, so investors lost enough money (SNGLS, REP, etc.);  The token value is not in correlation with the techo used, but is inherent to the projects themselves.  3. Counterparty already support "Spells of genesis" (your partner in this project), a successful project until now, so you can learn a lot from their experience;With Counterparty you already have a lot of people which experienced this kind of project with Spells of genesis, so they can understand easy and can invest in your game also;  We learned a lot from their experience. But our choices are ours.  4. With Counterparty you can use Indiesquare wallet and Book of Orbs, also tokenly, for safe sales of your assets or to exchange them;  Yes, the tools around Ethereum aren't mature yet. But our game neither. We think that when we will be ready, they will be too.  5. In Counterparty (Book of orbs) you already have a market for "in games digital assets" for Spells of genesis and Force of will, so players can exchange or sell your assets more easy, or you can make partnership with other games to use some legendary assets in more games;    We are forging our experience on Ethereum but we are not opposed to Counterparty, especially if they include a VM, like they said they will do. The game itself is not tied to Ethereum technology.  Actually, the 15 second block confirmation is very interesting for our decentralized store.  6. Another objection is regarding your partner ranks. I think is not a correct correlation between investment and bonuses ; ex. Moon Administrator 100.000 investment/ 8% extra bonus and Galactic Emperor 17x (1.700.000 investment) and only 2x (16%) extra bonus. The rapport 1:17 is too much in partner ranks, a normal rapport for 5 ranks could be 1:5 - you can start with 200.000/400/600/800/1.000.000.  Correct balance between ranks is not an easy task. Galactic Emperor has one major bonus : he is the first who can trade newly created assets   Thank you for your support, the luck is welcome but the work will do the rest.

Author: ccedk_pr
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Three phases of Beyond the Void project   First Milestone(February 2017) Game Beta for Backers:  Make sessions of the game available for backers to try it out and give us feedback. We may take the game offline between sessions so we can focus on fixing issues and improving features. Make the shop functional for everyone to buy and trade game assets. Migrate the game server to a high-availability cluster that can scale along with the growing number of players. Create the first level of content, such as essential items and cards, for backers to own and play. Link the assets wallet to the backer's account. Backers can see the assets they own in their wallet, and can use those items in the game.   Second Milestone(April 2017) Open Game Beta:  Make the beta version of the game available to everyone. Offer welcome packages to early players. Grow our player community to over 1000 player accounts. Create the second level of content. The game must be rich and exciting to play, with many strategic possibilities. Complete a fully functional admin backend to manage the server cluster and player’s accounts.   Third Milestone(June 2017) Game release:  The official game release to the public. Beyond the Void will be in continuous development to add new content to the game and on the market. Create the third level of content. You will find the item’s listed below. Make players' public profile and stats available, including their Elo rating, game stats, current avatar, title, team affiliation, etc.    More Updates & News about "Beyond the Void" in socials and web-site: Twitter Facebook Beyond the Void

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: We won't distribute Nexiums during the game, so that's not an issue for us. As we said in the first milestone, we plan to split our server in a server cluster to be able to manage a large amount of players. The game will be released in June 2017, after two betas. That should give us time to test and improve if there are any issues.

Author: ccedk_pr
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: The backer ranks are available !   Each rank receives advantages and a Rank Card (like Ship Pilot or Constellation King). Some of the advantages are tied to the Rank card, and can only be sold or traded along with the card. To make these items easy to identify in the following tables, we’ve marked them with a star.   Frequently Asked Questions  1.On the crowdfunding page, it says 110 000€ fixed goal. What does that mean ? It means that, if we sell less than 110 000€ worth of Nexium in total, all of the backers can reclaim their Ethers. We already sold 5 million Nexiums during the pre-sale for 50 000€. There is still 60 000€ to go. Of course, we hope to sell a lot more than that so we can hire more developers and promote the game.  2.Is the Nexium price fixed ? Yes. The Nexium price will be fixed and announced on 24th of October. However, it may vary slightly during the crowdfunding, following the price of Ethers. 65 million tokens will be available to purchase during the crowdsale. All the unsold tokens will be burned (destroyed).    News about the game’s development  Beyond the Void N°4 - Damage types, Skills & Motherships (click to watch)  This last month our developers & game designer went all out developing new features: All the battle effects have been re-coded The skybox was improved We updated the graphics, including things like the planets, the skybox etc We updated the map, and implemented the tactical view We added new content such as Radar, satellites, etc     More Updates & News about "Beyond the Void" in socials and web-site: Twitter Facebook Beyond the Void

Author: ccedk_pr
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Beyond The Void Nexium ICO starts on November 1st  Beyond the Void - Real time strategy game powered by blockchain.  The Decentralised Conglomerate will be taking part in the support of the ICO coming up on November 1st as one of the major backers of the project involving both OpenLedger ApS and ICOO holders, and now this way as well via the DC marketing package offered to startups.  The token NEXIUM (NxC) will also be possible to trade on OpenLedger once the tokens are becoming available at launch time. You can find out more at http://beyond-the-void.net  Find out more details as well on Beyond the Void Bitcointalk Thread  Discover Nexium ICO Video    For ICOO breaking news and updates follow us! Facebook :: Twitter :: Linkedin

Author: Beyond the Void
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: Hi there !  In our ICO, a smart contract will be used as an escrow. It is written in the smart contract that we can't get the money if the 110 000€ goal is not reached. This smart contract will be published for everyone to see before the crowdfunding starts. Our marketing is being taken care of by our partner Openledger and the Decentralized Conglomerate. We might do bounties for translations, but we'll let everybody know when that happens.  Best regards

Author: aidia
Title: 🚀[ANN] Nexium [NXC]- Beyond the Void: First blockchain RTS
Body: I'm confused of the role of Investor and the economic model in this game. Couple questions.  Why should I invest in the game. Am I paid part of the future game revenue? Or is the ICO aimed for people who are willing to play the game in future?  How the value of Nexiums in circulation can grow?  How one can buy Nexiums in the game after the ICO, and who is the seller?  Are Nexiums used only between the players, or can you buy ie. Skins from game shop? If items are bought from Game provided shop, what happens to "used" Nexiums?
